description: Food was really good and portions were generous. The restaurant is busy, which adds to the atmosphere. The experience was enjoyable and I snapped a few pics!
author: Grace Z.

description:
Solid meal.
This place is great for a quick bite in San Francisco. The hash browns are crisp without being burnt and the eggs are cooked decent here. If you're looking for other options, they do sell pancakes and French toast variations. Neither of which is exceptional but they can make them with enough toppings to mask the lack of moisture in both. PS No Refills on the drinks and you will wait sometime for your order.
3 stars.
author: Jose V.

description:
This was not very good. It was greasy, and the ingredients were not high quality. I needed to eat before taking some medicine, and eating greasy, not good food didn't really help me. I was waiting for a prescription to be filled at the CVS across the street, and the longer I spent in there, the worse I felt. 

I ordered an omelette with toast. The food was heavy, the sausage seemed low quality, the cheese seemed not to ever really melt. The toast was almost too dry to eat. The restaurant was in need of deep clean, and the tech bros at the table next to me didn't enhance my experience, though I know there's no escaping this very specific type of 24-32 year old man when is SF. 

I found myself wishing I had eaten something - almost anything - else.
author: Julie S.

description:
Two stars because the food was mediocre and the service was BAD. I was planning to go to Dottie's down the street, but ended up coming here because the line was sooo long for Dottie's..

Homeskillet was crowded, but there wasn't really a wait. The place isn't the cleanest.. all the butter in the butter jar were melted so none of it was edible. The woman working at the cash register gave so much attitude and it just makes me wonder why she's working in a customer service industry??? 

Food was mediocre at best.. nothing really stood out to me.. it was a typical, but pricey American styled breakfast. I paid about $75 for 4 people.. 4 plates, 2 cups of coffee. It's about $11-$13/plate and they were pretty decently portioned if you want to share. House coffee that you get yourself was $3.95/cup ummmm... that's pretty expensive... even more than Starbucks. I had a cup of latte that didn't come til the end of my meal and I had to ask for it twice.. 

Tried getting a cap for my coffee cup afterwards and was given more attitude. Wouldn't recommend unless you're desperate like I was..
author: Jodie S.

description:
Decent breakfast place in Mid-Market in San Francisco! 

Location: Located on 6th and Market, which is close to Powell BART and a lot of MUNI stops. 

The restaurant: When you walk in, you order at the counter and put your number on your table. If you order coffee, you can fill the cup right next to the cashier. If you want water, there are cups and water just further down. When you are all done, there are black bins for you to put your dishes in before you leave. 

The food: I thought it was good. I had a chorizo hash and it was hardy and delicious. It came with hash browns and toast. My friend got pancakes, which I tried and I definitely would get next time. 

Super happy I work right next door to this place, because pre-work breakfast is always a good idea.
author: Chris O.

description: I thought this place was pretty solid. I came here for brunch with my friends and got the eggs Benedict with country potatoes. The Benedict's were pretty good and I really enjoyed the hollandaise. The potatoes were also pretty good. I thought the interior decor was pretty nice and the order style was pretty cool as you order food first then they give you a marker. Overall a pretty solid bench spot.
author: Lawrence H.

description:
Average American diner place in the city. The place is really cute though, especially the logo haha, but its located in the sketchy part of town.

I ordered a Chicken Apple Sausage Cheese Omelette ($12.95) with Hash Browns and Sourdough. The food was okay, I felt like the hash browns should have been seasoned a little bit more, but the sourdough was pretty good, not terribly sour. The omelette itself was not as big as I thought and I think it is a little bit expensive. However, I loved the big flavor and how much onions there was in it, both raw and cooked. There is a lot of mushrooms in it if that is not your thing.
author: Vivienne C.

description:
I had the Old Skool Sandwich and it was quite a let down to be honest. Despite the nice decorations and the attempt at an American diner kind of feel for the menu, the food was quite lacking. It was basically an attempt at a Reuben sandwich, without any of the goodness. 

There was barely any pastrami in it, it was basically just two giant slices of bread that had been grilled and oiled up, and the whole thing just felt kind of boring, like something I could make a better version of at home. This was a pass now and probably a pass in the future.
author: Tyler T.

description: Hole in the wall breakfast place.  Quick and friendly service. Food was basic fair.  Met my breakfast needs, when hotel kitchen was closed for breakfast due to fire.  The table signs are witty.
author: Meredith M.

description:
This is an average breakfast/lunch spot with a ridiculously long wait. 

 We waited about 40 min until finally being able to make our order (came in around 11:30Am) That may have been reasonable compared to other restaurants near by, as the original place we wanted to go had a line about two blocks long. 

I ordered a veggie/cheese omelette with sourdough toast (forgot to take pic) I also ordered a side of French toast...  my husband ordered a burger, add bacon with garlic fries.  My husband said his burger was delicious, cooked to perfection and full of flavor. My omelette was comparable to something you would expect at Denny's, flavorless, veggies Inside not of good quality and completely watery and bland, toast was served cold and butter less- they do have butter at the table but good luck spreading it on your freezing toast. My French toast seemed like it was going to be a hit, as the first piece was delicious! Perfect blend of cinnamon, cooked great- slightly crispy but still soft in the middle. The second piece was undercooked- doughy. 

The restaurant itself is fairly small with tables cafeteria style so you're most likely going to eat elbow to elbow with someone, unless you get a window seat- during busy hours, seating is assigned. 

Our walk to this area that the restaurant is located in was absolutely awful (we were coming from union square) the homeless population is flooding the street, a man was literally craping on the street about .1 mile from the restaurant, urine everywhere- over flow of trash and had to walk on the street to avoid walking thru a homeless encampment that lined the sidewalk. People obviously on drugs walking in and out of the restaurant and surrounding the place. 

I probably would not go out of my way to ever come to this area again.  My three star is based off my husband satisfaction for his burger.
author: Holly R.

description: Second time here and service was awesome.  The food and breakfast  are delicious! Kinda busy and has ling lines but it's worth the wait.
author: Gabe P.

description: In the middle of mid Market a hole in the wall a breakfast treasure. Staff is really nice and down to earth great food in San Francisco
author: Adrianita M.

description:
Visited Homeskillet on a day trip to the city. Went to see the Giants play an afternoon game at AT&T Park.  Decided on this place since they had good reviews.  We were starving when we got there, the line was short and moving fast.

Great breakfast menu, lots of home style egg dishes.  I ordered the egg Benedict with hash browns, all home made, and fresh squeezed OJ.  Everything was super good! and service was fast.  My friend has the 2 egg toast and country style potatoes, he ate it all and said it was perfect.  

The place was clean, small, so seating was tight, but everything moved fast so seats came open pretty quick.

If you want a good home cooked breakfast, this is the place.
author: Walter R.

description:
Parking is pretty awful and the neighborhood is not great. It is filled with panhandlers so if you're a tourist, beware. 

I ordered the chorizo egg Benedict with hashbrowns and my friend had the French toast with bacon and eggs on the side.

Egg Benedict: the English muffin was burnt, the egg was not fully cooked and the sauce was very minimal. 
Hashbrowns: bland and literally felt like I was eating mashed potatoes. 
Chorizo: BURNT and probably no more than half a cup of meat 

Sunny side eggs: fair, nothing special 
Bacon: BURNT and dry. 
French toast: decent 

Interior design: tries to make it look like an old school diner but yet has random decorations of modernism.

Overall, we only came here because a diner nearby few shops down, was closed for Black Friday/thanksgiving weekend. They love to burn food here for some reason as everything was burnt and dry. It was one of the least flavored egg Benedict I ever tried in my life. My chorizo is definitely a frozen item that was heated up. 

Nothing special, pricey at an average of $13 a meal. 

+ points for quickness and spacious. 

Overall, D+ grade.
author: Kevin P.

description:
We were walking around looking around for a breakfast spot and came across homeskillet. There was a slight line so we said hey it can't be too bad if there are people in line for it.

We were right! The fresh squeezed orange juice is a must and I ordered an egg, bacon, cheese breakfast sandwich and it hit the spot! I wasn't overly stuffed as I walked out but was satisfied with my food! That's a win in my book :)
author: Amir J.

description: Great food served promptly! The dining area has plenty of space so your party will have more than enough room to enjoy your brunch. Can't beat the location either.
author: Roger T.

description:
It's a pretty good brunch place: 3/5. 
Pro's: the wait is not crazy ridiculous. Ordered Sugar Mama and the french toast was delicious. My co-workers ordered burgers, and tuna and turkey sandwiches and they were satisfied with them. The serving size and price range were reasonable.
Con's: the other food on my plate was just meh. I guess just don't expect too much. But still, it's worth going to. (Like when you're starving and Dottie's line goes all around the block)
author: Michaella A.

description: I ordered a cheese burger and you get the option to get it with fries or a salad. I got a salad. It was good and tiny, perfect for me. But if you have a big appetite, order the fries. The meat was so juicy and I love the melted cheddar. Definitely going back there.
author: Julie E.

description:
- Taste: meh
- Value: meh
- Service: ok. fast, not super friendly
- Ambiance: meh

Came here since the line for Dottie's way too long (even on a Friday at 12pm - lame).  No wait here. 

$12.51 post tax for chicken sausage scramble, mixed greens and toast. Sausage wasn't super flavorful, omelette was pretty oily and salad drenched in mediocre balsamic. Enjoyed the thick rye toast though!

TLDR: wouldn't go out of your way for homeskillet but it got the job done... would opt for dottie's if you're set on bfast, or jin mi if you're looking for good value.
author: Kristie C.

description:
We went here because Dottie's had an insane line! My girlfriend had to head to a training so she only had about an hour to order and eat, so we're like okay we'll do your meal to go right? Wrong. This place serves your food up SO FAST AND FRESH. Our whole table of food was out in less than ten minutes and we had plenty of time to enjoy our food and she was 15 minutes early to her appointment. This is a great little gem. 

The food: it was okay. It wasn't anything special or monumental, but it definitely wasn't mediocre. The hash browns we're good and the eggs were perfect, but it just wasn't mind blowing.
author: Kamryn K.

description: A nice little place with a really good breakfast!  I got the chicken apple sausage omelet with country potatoes and wheat toast.  Definitely a breakfast I would recommend!
author: Dan L.

description:
I have a feeling this place picks up a fair bit of business from people who don't want to wait for Dottie's, a block away. That's certainly what got us here. It's a casual little diner type place, order at the counter. They have all the breakfast basics. 

My husband got the banana French toast and thought it was good. 3 slices of bread with a fries banana on top. I opted for a breakfast sandwich with hash browns. The hash browns were good; they had some sort of speciality seasoning on them I liked. The sandwich was not good. The bacon was really under cooked, so very stringy and unappealing, instead of crispy bacon. The eggs were like quick cooked on a flat top with that weird consistency you might expect from say, Carl's Jr., instead of actually scrambled. The bread for the sandwich was good. The whole thing was really really greasy, to the point where my napkin was saturated and my throat felt coated. The coffee was good.

Breakfast for 2 set back just over $20, so for the area, super cheap. I think this is a place that's good for maybe a quick bit, coffee, maybe pancakes. I would stay away from more complicated things like eggs and bacon.
author: Sarah S.

description: This place has no vegan option and made zero effort to amend anything on the menu. We saw reviews mentioning a vegan donut, but that option apparently does not exist here. The service is unfriendly at best.
author: Macey J.

description: Food/Service was nothing exceptional. Definitely mediocre but worth eating if you're hungry.
author: Nobuki F.

description: Soooooo good! Had the portobello Benedict and it was sooo good I would def eat here again. We were actually waiting in line at another restaurant which had about an hour wait, a few of our friends decided to walk down a ways to see if there were other options for breakfast, they found this place not much of a long wait..... Oh and did I mention they have fresh squeezed OJ.
author: Dave Nd Rose P.

description:
So..the line is too long at Dottie's?
Maybe head down the street and try Homeskillet.
My wife and I tried it this morning and we liked it.

It's not a big restaurant, but it's not small.
First of all, once you walk in, you order your food, pay and then they assign you a table.

The breakfast menu relatively small. I had a Sugar Mama, which was basically a combo of French Toast and eggs, with bacon.
The food wasn't totally hot, but I come to realize that combo plates are hard to keep hot. I'd say it was hot enough.
My verdict is that the meal was very good. 
The service was warm and fast. I saw just two servers and they covered a lot of ground.

I definitely will eat there again. Dottie's may have lost a customer.  Well... my wife might not agree.
author: Darryl L.

description: Good food, pleasant service. Hubby got healthy servings of eggs, bacon, and French toast with oj and a coffee. $22. Way better pricing than the fancy place down the street.
author: Megan S.

description: Best veg burger I have ever had. Perfectly cooked, seasoning not overdone, bun was great, just needed a bit of ketchup.
author: Di H.

description: Very good & plentiful breakfast. They were able to accommodate my wife's dairy allergy. Very good friendly service.
author: P F.

description: I love this place, I try to come here for brunch anytime I'm staying around Union Square. The tater tots are so delicious!! But you have to ask for them directly, they're not written on the menu.
author: Dana S.

description: Went here as alternate because Dottie was too busy to accommodate us.  A home cook tasty meal with large portion to boot!!! Can't go wrong with this place!!
author: Prince M.

description: Soooo good and soooo fresh!!! I had the original eggs Benedict and it was the best eggs Benedict I had ever had! The hollandaise sauce was not to runny and not too thick. The Canadian bacon had really good flavor. The English muffin was not over cooked and the eggs were cooked to a nice medium. I had country potatoes with it and they had really good flavor! Kind of garlicky. Oh and did I mention that when it came out, you could see the steam rolling off. I definitely found my new breakfast spot in SF and I highly recommend!
author: Aubrey M.

description: Came here because the line for Dotties was around the corner and there was no wait for Homeskillet. Love you can fill your own coffee mug because I hate waiting for refills. I ordered an egg white omelet with ham, no butter, dry wheat toast and side of fruit. What I got (pictured) was butter laden. I brought it back and they were quick to remake it and it was perfect. Hubby got the egg, bacon, cheese sandwich on sourdough with hash browns. He loved his sandwich but the hash browns could have been crispier. This place is like your typical diner. Hubby said he would go back, I say no. Good customer service though and the place is super clean.
author: Kelly M.

description:
This was literally just okay. I like the system where you order and pay first, then are seated and wait for your food. Sadly, I imagine customers probably don't tip very well because you're paying like it's take out even though wait staff bring you your food and can serve you water (though you can also serve yourself water). 

As for the food, I got the eggs benedict with hash brown and whole wheat toast. Everything was pretty meh - the hash brown was not seasoned at all, despite the description in the menu, and the hollandaise sauce didn't taste like much. Some of the other dishes might be better but I wouldn't go back to check it out.
author: Leslie C.

description: Pancakes exactly as you want them- fluffy, buttery, and delicious! The serving sizes were huge too. My mom got the French toast and has already decided we're going again tomorrow so she can get it again. Fast, kind service too!
author: Beth M.

description: Hair in my food and such horrible service.  Since when do I have to ask for utensils and/or a napkin at a restaurant?  Never ever going there again.
author: Richard P.

description: Location,  location, location...unfortunate location. Decent food, decent service. Suggestion is to not sit by the window. There appeared to be a parade of drifters, down-and-outs, and others who have had a series of unfortunate events. Whilst we were sitting and eating 20-30 were at the window, one violently slapped the window, many stopped to watch us eat and mumbled not so pleasant words...my suggestion is to avoid a window seat. The food, the chicken sausage with eggs and toast was basic. The #9 breakfast sandwich with cheese and avocado and eggs can definitely be eaten by two. The homefries were tasty. The medium and dark coffee were delicious.  Coffee is self serve and bottomless. Service of the cashier was warm and inviting.
author: Genie M.

description:
I've always been curious, but never really walked in. One day, a friend shared half of their turkey/egg/cheese croissant sandwich for breakfast. It was so simple and juicy that I have thought about stopping by every morning!

The place is very small, but quaint. You can order in, order out, big plate, or smaller pastries and goods (ie: scones, bagels, croissants, breakfast sandwiches, etc). I didn't stray too far from what I tried the first time: a black forest ham/cheese/egg croissant sandwich to-go. 

Both are virtually the same in design, but there was more turkey meat compared to the amount of ham they put into each respective sandwich. Cheese ooziness remained the same as did the scrambled egg and croissant. Between the two, I prefer ham mostly for the flavors, but the bites were juicier and more satisfying or the turkey version simply because of the amount of meat. 

I can't wait to try out more of their breakfast dishes!
author: Sofia R.

description:
I have a feeling most people come here since Dottie's is too busy? We were too hungry to really care and don't regret it afterwards. I am not from SF and honestly don't get why would anyone ever wait for brunch more than 10 minutes.
Food is nothing fancy but it's quite tasty. Service is quick and we got seated fairly quickly considering the place was packed.
Price is okay and portions are fairly generous. 
Only bad impression was the tables are too close to each other. I think they're supposed to be sitting 4 people but the staff split them cause there were more couples eating breakfast than large groups.
author: Stanimir C.

description: Real good breakfast food, have yet to be disappointed. That said, getting there and eating there makes me feel uncomfortable. The area is a mess and the glass windows means that the people shopping at the "vendors" get to watch you eat.
author: Dave J.

description: Ate here because the wait was too long at Dottie's. It was a great choice. The french toast was delicious, friendly service, I'll go back!
author: L W.

description: Friendly atmosphere great food meet new people, had pancake breakfast the first time and homestyle the next AM love this spot
author: Jacqueline S.

description:
We actually jumped in after having seen a long long queue for Dottie's but got a great surprise!!!
Service is fast and meal delicious!!
Totally recommend it!
author: Monica L.

description: We got the fried chicken waffles and strawberry fresh toast. We were pleasantly surprised by how juicy and tender the friend chicken was! It was indeed better than anywhere else that's actually known for that dish ! The waffle was perfectly crispy but also soft on the inside -- not dry or soggy at all! The portions are big, so it's a good bang for the buck. The french toast was also perfectly cooked and not greasy or soggy like others. Would definitely come back for the chicken and waffles !
author: Shirley T.

description: The food was pretty good for breakfast, very tasty. Service was relatively fast for delivery of food but you need pick up your own coffee, water, and juice. I ordered the "Good Hombre Eggs Benedict" for my meal and this is where my issue comes in. The poached eggs that were served as part of the dish were completely overcooked. The yolk was completely solid like in a hard boiled egg. Considering that various Eggs Benedict dishes made up a big part of the menu, I didn't quite expect this.
author: Andrew H.

description: This place is getting all of their kickbacks from Dottie's. Saw this place on a review. Was originally going to Dottie's. There was also a line there but they were fast & efficient. The bagel's were fresh, they were generous with the cream cheese. Got there around 10:30 am. Didn't  expect with establishment to be busy on a Monday. Everyone was polite! Chorizo scramble was amazing! Close to all activity!
author: Angel C.

description: I ordered a ham and cheese omelette, my omalete consisted of sandwich ham and American style Kraft's cheese, I was not satisfied with the omalete. Also if your thirsty for coffee or water be prepared to get up and grab it yourself. Also on that note you will have to awkwardly squeeze by people's tables in order to get your beverage and good luck not to spill any of your hot coffee because the coffee cups they give you is tiny. Further more not all tables have condiments such as sugar , hot sauce, or ketchup. My meal cost approximately twenty dollars. Please save your money and patients for another restaurant.
author: Shane M.

description: Decent little restaurant in the worst part of town. You order and pay up front and then get a number. They have cute little sayings on each number that amps up the atmosphere. I got a California love - sourdough and avocado and egg. It was a great sandwich. The hash browns were lacking but the sandwich made up for it.
author: Kristina K.

description: Staff is friendly, area is not the best. Inside is kept up ok. Food was ok... Felt it needed more flavor, and change of flavor to the potatoes.
author: Allee C.

description:
I came to Homeskillet with my friend for a midday brunch during the work week. Unfortunately, we didn't know that brunch ends at 12 pm and at 12:30, we could only order from the lunch menu (sandwiches and burgers mostly). I was looking forward to an eggs benedict and tots and I was disappointed!! :( 

We ordered the fried pork sandwich with garlic fries and another sandwich that I can't remember the name of... Haha. The fried pork sandwich was good, it had pulled pork and veggies. I chose BBQ sauce for a classic combo. The meat was good and spilled over onto the plate from the bread. The garlic fries were just plain french fries smothered in garlic and oil... They were garlicky and hot, but the bottom of the dish was very oily and made them look unappetizing. The pool of oil made it seem like they just fried the garlic in oil and poured both the garlic AND the oil over the fries... Therefore too much oil. The other sandwich had turkey, melted cheese, and a cranberry sauce. It was good except I wasn't aware that it was super spicy!! The bread was delicious though, very crunchy and buttery. 

Overall an ok place for lunch. I wouldn't come back for the sammies but the benedicts are still very appealing! Maybe if I can walk there from work before 12... Haha.
author: Tara A.

description:
A group of us came here for lunch after a tour.
The service was fast and pleasant.
I had a simple sandwich and potato chips made there.  It was all pretty good and I took half of it home for a future lunch.
This is a good place to go for a good, inexpensive lunch if you are in the neighborhood.
author: Philip C.

description:
Stumbled upon this brunch spot today while walking around the city. So happy we are here!  You just walk in and find a table, not formal where there's servers or hosts on the floor. Which is honestly sometimes just what your looking for... I was hungover and didn't want to have to communicate a lot or have to keep telling the server that I'm fine and yes, my food is great. The menu has a wide variety to choose from and after 20 minutes of trying to decide between the scramble or the spinach wrap burrito, I ended up with the burrito! 

I'm a small person with a big appetite. Unfortunately, I never finish my food. I literally ate half my burrito and picked at my spring green salad. It was scrumptious! The drink menu looked pretty good! I was tempted to try the hot green tea latte but I'm not a hot drink person. So I asked for Thai tea and they didn't have the ingredients to make it apparently. (Reason why I marked them down a star) 

I'll be back for sure! Can't wait to eat the "sugar mama" ( they have pretty cool names for the food) always a nice bonus!
author: Valery T.

description:
Best!! Best brunch ever. Seriously amazing little cafe. They do really good coffees and anything can be modified. The service is really super fast and the prices are reasonable for being in this location. 

It is upscale nice without the hella crazy prices. I had the best omelet and toast and cappuccino ever.
author: Kim P.

description: We came because Dottie's was too full and there was no wait here. Got the Chorizo Benedict with the country potatoes. I was a little afraid to try it but I'm so happy I did! It was delicious. Highly recommend.
author: Daniela M.

description: Fist time order food here because we planed to eat Dottie, however the owner said they will close due to short ppl, so sad to hear that. Since we don't want to waiting for the long line, we get here at 7:20am...., unfortunately they close today, then we move to the next door breakfast, I order the #1 old fashion breakfast, maybe Sth happened to the server she looks so sad as she ask me what I want to order in the early morning. After get my food, too much oily, potato tasted so bland, after we tasted our food, we would rather go to McDonald's breakfast. Also their is a hair on my coffee cup, too much complain for me. Emmmmm
author: Yueming G.

description:
My friends and I had our first meal together here during our trip to SF several months ago. We chose to eat here simply because it was located down the street from where we were staying at.
 
Just like most of the other places we had gotten food from while in SF, there was a line here, albeit, the line wasn't too long (we waited about 15-20 minutes before getting served). We all got our food to go as we had to catch a tour group not too long after. I would say that eating one of their large breakfast entrees while on the go was not a good idea on our part, but despite the large mess that my food had become whilst being transported in a cardboard container, I just didn't think my food (veggie scramble) was too good. The portion was large, but the flavors were all kind of competing against one another and it just felt heavy.
 
I guess it's not a bad place to go to, though, if you don't want to wait on the line of nearby Dottie's.
author: Cinthia K.

description: I went twice during my trip to SFO to have breakfast in this place they have a very well planned take and go service. Before you start to order the ask if you are going to take a sit and they reserve it for you which I loved because you don't have to rush to take a table. After you ordered they bring you the beverages and after a while your meals. I tried chocolate banana pancakes on one visit and their hashtag breakfast on another one. Their White chocolate mocha is fantastic and their fresh squeeze orange juice is made on heaven! I also loved all their decorations, it's a complete breakfast experience.
author: Astrid V.

description: Great food, not super cheap but somewhat affordable, kinda hole in the wall. Got the "99 problems" and it was great. Would recommend to someone n I would return
author: Chris C.

description: It's a great thing when you wake up in the morning and excited to go out to breakfast. I'm just visiting and I wanted breakfast, originally I wanted Dottie's but sadly the line was long and I was hungry now. So just a few stores down you'll find Homeskillet, it has a line but it moves quickly enough so I go ahead and try it. The pricing is around $20 a person so it's reasonable to me. For the quality though I would never pay that!!! I ordered a ham and cheese omelet but it felt more like a ham and cheese sandwich! They used kraft cheese that they didn't even care to melt all the way and they used lunch meet! I have never had an omelet like this. I wouldn't recommend, it's nice that it's fast if you are waiting in line, but they are constantly rushing you, looking at you like vultures for you to finish. So sad to find out that breakfast can be ruined.
author: Brianna M.

description:
This place is perfectly located for people who literally can't even with the line at Dottie's.  Reminiscent of greasy diners, but in a comfortable fast casual setting.  Great for folks who enjoy eating breakfast for lunch, because why shouldn't you have brunch (minus the mimosas) during the workday?

99 Problems: I feel like I should include some witty Jay-Z reference, but I won't.  Super tasty mishmash of so much fatty goodness.  Flavorful ground beef, crispy hash brown bits, gooey cheese, two fried eggs, sour cream and lots of onions.  It all meshes together for a very rich and indulgent breakfast.  I'd suggest looking under the eggs and mixing up everything a bit before you dig in.  The sautéed onions were all in a pile and were a bit overwhelming by themselves.  Also, the cheese clump tended to be isolated in certain quadrant as well.  I opted for an everything bagel and cream cheese as my side bread.  Definitely tasty, but I could only finish half since the main plate was so intense.

Pomegranate Limeade: Refreshing.  Tart, but not too sour.  The acidic nature is a perfect way to cut the fatty richness of the 99 problems.
author: Adam B.

description: The food was ok. The people were nice and the line moved quickly. The Egg Benedict was good but there was a hair in my salad. My friend got the French toast and it was not good. My partner got the veggie burger and he said it was only ok. Overall the restaurant was ok but definitely not the best.
author: Linda R.

description:
Given the abundance of amazing food in San Francisco, it's difficult for Homeskillet to compete. However, the wait was minimal compared to some other more popular locations, and the food was good enough. 

I honestly forget what day of the week it was, but the line was kind of out the door. But keep in mind that the place is kind of small, so even if the line is out the door, the wait isn't too bad. Homeskillet is one of those places where you take a table marker and someone brings your food out to you, but everything else is self-service. So after ordering a coffee and the Tortilla Sunrise (breakfast burrito) with chicken apple sausage, my friend and I managed to find some seating by the window.

The coffee was okay, but can't really compete with some of the great coffeeshops around the city. The burrito was better than I expected. It was bigger than I expected! Extremely filling. The dish originally comes with a side of homeskillet hash, but I opted for the salad (which I pretend like cancels out the oozing cheese and sour cream in the burrito). Just get the hash. The salad was drenched in dressing, and I couldn't finish it... Honestly, I'd return to Homeskillet to order that burrito again. I've had better breakfast burritos, but I've also had much worse. 

I'd recommend giving it a shot if you don't feel like waiting at the more popular breakfast locations in the city.
author: Haley B.

description:
(My 200th review, whaaat?) Just a 5 minute walk from the Powell BART station and 2 seconds from the seemingly world-renown "Dottie's" -Homeskillet delivers a hometown feel in the SF city. 

The interior of the restaurant is cozy and warm (scorching hot, maybe their AC was broken that day). The decor is cute and there is one table for communal seating among other small tables and counter seating against the window. Each table has a tray of hot sauces and syrup ready to use. As well as the silverware packed in cups for easy access.  

I ordered a vegetarian option called #hashtag which consists of 2 eggs however you want them, your choice of toast or a bagel and extra 99cents to get that with cream cheese, hashbrowns fried with onions and drizzled with sour cream. Topped off with a small avocado. I spent $10.88 on this meal...but it sustained my hunger pains! 
 
The taste of the food was decent. I ordered a garlic bagel with my meal but unfortunately the outer area with all the garlic was burnt to a crisp. And everyone knows what burnt garlic tastes like. The rest of the plate kinda blended together as it was all the same consistency...scrambled eggs and a mush of potatoes and onions. 

I was still satisfied with my meal nonetheless, and I do recommend coming here especially if you have somewhere to be. Their service is quick as you order upon entry and they bring the food out to you in about 5 minutes tops.
author: Melanie B.

description:
5 stars for their delicious French toast! This place is located around the corner from Dottie's, and not nearly as populated. I was able to walk right in and place my order. This will definitely be my go-to place for French toast when on my way to work/have a hankering for some good eats. Gotta love the greasy spoon places. I feel like they're a dying breed here, so I must support them (at least on principle alone)

Likes:
-fast service (for those looking for a quick bite to eat on your way into work)
-French toast is DELISH! Highly recommend
-located near BART
-variety of tea and coffee offerings, in addition to quick foods like bagels, etc (I think they also offer a yummy doughnut, but didn't see it the day I was there)
-reasonable (given prices for food in the city)
-accepts both cash and credit

Dislikes:
-located on a pretty grimy corner (but still walkable)
-walking/BART is probably fastest way to get here...don't bother looking for parking (there's virtually none on Market street)
author: Tracy T.

description:
For Sunday in San Francisco specially when the Day Breakers parade was going on this place had no wait even though all tables seemed full. They are really good at getting guests in and out. Coffee is self serve, you order, pay and than get seated which saves a lot of time .
 The menu has your typical bakery items,egg combos and omelettes. We tried the French Toast and Farmers omelette which were both delicious, the order came out quick was pleasing to look at at and tasted great . 

    They have three types of coffee blends mild, medium and dark roasts which I think is a good change from the single offering other places had in the area .
author: Imran Q.

description: Most places were pretty crowded this Saturday morning so we found this place. Short line, you order in line than they give you assigned seating when they are busy. Food was good I had the burger omelette with a green salad and coffee.
author: Rich B.

description: This tiny restaurant was packed this Sunday after the race. It tables side to side with barley enough room to slide by. The staff tho is quick at turning over and cleaning the tables. You order first and pay at the cashier then they bring the food to you. For all the people that was there they did a pretty good job of moving quickly through the line. Our food came out fast and was on point and big portions. Price for 2 people with juice and 3 dishes was about $30 not bad for the city. Parking no where to be found. We walked from the event about 3 blocks from the civic center. Bathrooms clogged and messy hence -1 star. Otherwise all was satisfactory.
author: Theresa G.

description:
We stopped here after a near by diner was packed with over 1hr wait. We were too hungry to wait that long so I found this place on Yelp. We needed food asap!

We waited a few minutes for our order. It's a first come first serve spot, so as seats become available, the cashier takes your order. I ordered The chorizo scrambled and it was delicious. Our whole group loved the food.

Self serve water and coffee which didn't bother us. This will definitely be a go to spot for last minute chow.
author: Jairo A.

description:
I came in on a Monday morning looking for a quick but delicious breakfast and stumbled upon home skillet. There was a bit of a wait but the specials and diner vibe sealed the deal for me. I ordered the #hashtag meal which came with a lot for breakfast--just like a diner meal should! Overall, although it satisfied my hunger and breakfast craving, it was pretty greasy and lacking flavor (thank goodness for hot sauce!)

I probably wouldn't venture here again the next time I'm in town but could see it being a spot for locals with their huge servings and quick service, definitely a diner experience! If you can, try to come with someone to snag a table while you wait to order as tables get snagged up quick.

Also, my sister had an issue with their "chocolate chip" pancake. If you are picky about chocolate chip pancakes, don't order it! They just sprinkled chocolate chips on top of the pancake and not in the actual batter. Although they fixed it, they did so with a sigh and attitude... Not the best customer aerice
author: Crystal R.

description:
Sad experience. Ordered a bagel with turkey and cheese. The girl told me they had no bagel and didn't offer a substitute. I left then came back to order a sourdough turkey and cheese sandwich. I found the price a bit high but then saw there was an egg on my receipt. I politely told her that I didn't asked for egg. She told the kitchen but didn't change the price. I asked if it was lower as I found 7$ expensive for a turkey cheese sandwich she said they didn't have it on the menu so it was the same price.
Their menu logic:
Ham & cheese 5.5
Ham, egg & cheese 6.5
Turkey, egg & cheese 6.5

Turkey & cheese 6.5 ???

Bad service when nicely asking to explain.
author: Marie-France L.

description: Good decent breakfast for folks that don't want to wait for Do little. We had to wait, but not too long to get a table for 4.
author: Harris M.

description:
This place is in the hood, but it was kind of fun waiting in line. Since my wife and I were tourists, we were not sure about the neighborhood too well. Besides the gang of wheel chair men dragging a pit bull so it can poop on the outside of the restaurant, homeless people stumbling around with a paper bag full of mystery drink, and the maniac screaming and cursing about the bible, and the cops driving by singing, "why can't we be friends," to him to fire him up even more, it wasn't too bad? Right?

But I digress. It was a busy Sunday morning, and people were hungry. So there was a long line to get in. The service wasn't the friendliest, since they were so busy, but I wasn't butt hurt, I get it. The food was really good, and it came out quick! If I visit the Bay Area again, will defiantly come back.
author: Adnan S.

description:
Depending on the day, breakfast out in San Francisco is a nightmare!  Homeskillet does an adequate job at moving people in and out.  On this weekend the line was out the door and around the corner by 9:30am, the wait for a party of four was 15/20 minutes. 

We came here by default, based on the outrageous line and wait down the street.  Our experience was 'interesting.'  As we were placing our orders, a homeless man pushed his way through the line and stole the tip jar.  Hello!?  

The breakfast fare is very average.  My youngest had the sugar mamma pancakes, which were good (B), and the rest of us had the old fashion breakfast (C+) which allows for some customization in what you get and how they serve it, the food was just okay.

Other strange things to look for... when it gets busy they are understaffed, so there is no true table service, you get put at a table and they deliver your food, but that's it.  Despite a huge line, they are slow to clean and clear tables.  As we sat at our table, my daughter looked up to discover that almost all the light bulbs are burned out, 17 out of 22, file that under peculiar. 

Overall this was just Okay, cost was around $15/person.
author: Chris G.

description: This is a great little greasy spoon diner. Visiting from out of town, and came here to meet an old buddy for breakfast. There was no wait food was decent and reasonably priced, and the service attentive. No complaints!
author: Asa K.

description:
This place is okay for counter serve on the go food for those of us who work non stop. They have legit food options that also coincide well the bustle of Market Street. However, the food is also cooked in a hurried manner. If you're focusing on fast service, expect fast service food. Pretty much better options for Denny's quality.

https://www.instagram.com/p/BW2wEPRDeKX/

https://www.instagram.com/p/BW2ypJpj2v-/
author: Veggie E.

description:
This place is weird. You order first at the counter, and then you go try to seat yourself. The distance from the counter to the door is quite short, so people are naturally awkwardly lining up out the door. As a result of this service, there is actually surprise, no service, apart from them delivering the food to you.

The food itself is rather standard American breakfast. 

I got the chocolate chip pancakes with bacon and eggs. The breakfast was forgettable. The pancakes were large but a little on the darker side. The chocolate chips were also haphazardly thrown onto the top pancake, although the other pancake did have some chips embedded in the batter. The whole plate just looked funny because I thought they were just super lazy and tossed some chocolate chips on top.

The whole breakfast seemed rather forgettable, and I really didn't like how they structured their seating.
author: Danielle C.

description: Had a few hours to kill in the area this morning, so I popped in here for breakfast. I was able to get a table pretty quickly (not bad for a Saturday) and the staff was quite friendly and efficient. The food came out at a reasonable time, my eggs were cooked just as I like them (over easy with no drip) and were quite tasty.  Why the three stars?  Albeit tasty, everything on my plate was cold, the hashbrowns were undercooked and my toast was almost burned.  It was a pretty busy morning, but that shouldn't be an excuse.  I hope to give them another chance, maybe at a non-peak time of the day.
author: Fabio B.

description:
This place gets really busy in the morning.  Originally tried to go to another restaurant on same block, but this was less of a wait.  However, we should have passed and waited in line at the other restaurant because my mother's omelette had a hair in it.

This is not the end of the world, but the low rating is reflective of other things like the line being too long, the cleaning staff not busing the tables quickly enough, and the tables and chairs too close together that every time someone needs to get by, you have to constantly move your chair otherwise they won't make it through.

It was chaotic inside.  One person taking all the orders.  No one really overseeing the dining area, other than bringing out food.  Feels very understaffed.

Would not recommend if looking for a peaceful breakfast experience.
author: Lan C.

description:
I was so devastated that the Pearl's burger joint on the busy corner of Sixth and Market Street had shut down. In comes another breakfast joint to compete with Dottie's (Guy Fieri's favorite), which is only a few doors down near the alley.

I was here twice for breakfast and both times before the Warrior's game at Oracle. My first visit, I had the "99 problems hash". For $11.50, I get chopped sausage, vegetables, mixed with shredded potatoes to form a hearty hash. I also get two over-easy eggs on top and a toasted bagel. This dish is a definitely a dish for meat-lovers, like myself. 

My second visit (3/8), I had the simple Eggs Benedict. For $9.00, I get two slices of Canadian bacon, egg and thick toasted English muffin smothered in a creamy Hollandaise sauce. My meal also comes with hash browns. A simple dish and hearty I enjoyed eating. 

Just forewarning, when you dine there, you will see all the crazy action on the busy street corner. Try not to look at the action and enjoy your meal.

Dottie's is usually a popular breakfast spot in the area. If that restaurant is busy, you might consider this place for breakfast as a second option.
author: Matt G.

description:
Brunch in San Francisco means you have to wait at least 45 minutes in line before scoring the cramped 2-top table shoved in the corner where everyone bumps into you because it's right by the door and you always feel a cold wind draft when the door opens. But hey, eggs benedict AmIrite?

I was planning on going to Dottie's down the street. But the line winding around the block made me think otherwise. Feeling defeated, I walked back towards market hungry and unsure of where to go. Out of curiosity, I peaked at Homeskillet's menu and was surprised that they have a tofu scramble! Surprise find!

It's a super fast-casual diner, where you order at the counter and have food brought to your table. Tables go quickly at this seat-yourself establishment, but luckily they clear up quickly as people seem to eat here very quickly.

I ordered the tofu scramble, which comes with mushrooms and spinach. For the sides, you can do breakfast potatoes and toast. Instead of toast, I actually upgraded for a Vegan Donut! They have all sorts of flavors too, including chocolate, strawberry, crumb, blueberry, etc. 

The cashier even suggested that I can do a tofu scramble breakfast burrito if I wanted to!

Food comes out quickly, and is actually pretty tasty. You get plenty of food for the price. I was pretty stuffed and packed the rest of my scramble to eat later.
This is not the best place to sit and have long conversations, because the tables are literally touching each other, or are communal style. 
I've been here twice now and enjoyed both visits. And I'm also pretty sure that the entire timing of both trips still does not equate to the timing needed for 1 visit at Dottie's. Their loss!
author: Lanie L.

description: Good place for a quick breakfast. Well cooked food in good portions. I had eggs Benedict and banana chocolate pancakes. Everything had hit the spot. No complaints.
author: Dima D.

description: Service was good. It's a busy Saturday morning and this place is counter service, but they took our orders quickly and had a table ready for our group of 4. Food came out hot and quick. I had he chicken sausage scramble, it was delicious and the toast was perfect. Toasted, warm, and fluffy. My moms got the lox special. Delicious. The Good Hombe was great. All in all s good breakfast experience.
author: Alex C.

description: This was fast, friendly, and not at all crowded. Today's special was Nutella stuffed hot cakes. But they also had traditional breakfast with just enough options to know they cooked it correctly. Just down the street from Dottie's whose line kept me away.
author: Stephen M.

description: The best breakfast!! I got the California breakfast sandwich on sourdough which has egg, cheese, bacon, and avocado. They put plenty of avocado and cheese and it is sooo delicious! Coffee is not very good. Hash browns are amazing!!
author: Michelle M.

description: This place is great! We won't lie, we tried to go to Dottie's first with this as a back up because both looked good. We quickly came to realize Dottie's line up was ridiculously long so we thought we'd give Homeskillet a try. It was awesome! You order first, then sit and wait for your food. It comes quick and was really tasty! I ordered chocolate chip banana French toast and my husband got an omelet with bacon, veggies, cheese that came with a side of shredded hash browns and toast. Everything was great. Would definitely go again and so worth not waiting an hour in line for brunch.
author: A W.

description: Just order the chorizo benedict with the taters and pomegranate limeade.  Get in there about 2 hours before your show at the Golden Gate Theater across the street.  Don't think you'll get in and out an hour before coz there are few tables in here.  Or you can get your benedict to go and park yourself in front of Crazy Horse and partake of your eats.
author: Joc V.

description: We've been here a few times...always a pleasant breakfast experience. There's always a short, but (worthwhile) wait. My favorite is their hot cakes topped with caramelized pecans -- and their coffee is consistently yummy! My only criticism is against customers who feel entitled to break the house rules regarding the obvious line and seating order. If and when you do go, please wait in line to order your meal -- before cutting in front of others to "save a table." You know who you are; Don't be a d-bag.
author: Ed1 C.

description:
Dottie's was closed, so I found this spot while driving around looking for a breakfast spot. Parking was a bit tricky... for us, until we scored a meter spot.

The inside wasn't exactly what I expected, from the appearance from the outside and what I expected from a place with the name Homeskillet. I guess, I was thinking that it would be less hipsterish. Don't get me wrong, I like hipsterish, so it's a good thing. I waited about 10 minutes at the counter to order. There were several odd characters who walked in and didn't order. One lady scooped up a bunch of packets of mustard and ketchup and then went out, about her merry way... odd. 

The lady who took my order at the counter was the same one who brought out my breakfast. She was very friendly. I ordered a green burrito and it came with a side salad. Both were excellent and memorable. Call me sheltered, but it was here that I had my first scone. It was lemon and blueberry and it was good too. I think my drink, meal, tip and scone were around $17... which wasn't too bad for a downtown meal.

Would I eat here again? I doubt it, but where are all of the breakfast options in the area and why was Dottie's closed on a weekday?!
author: Heather P.

description: Was introduced to this restaurant by my best friend who worked here. Would recommend this place if you had a big appetite. Their burgers are huge and I had a hard time finishing it. It's a great bang for your buck. Their portions of fries are also big. Really great service too!
author: Dominique C.

description: Classic American breakfast stop. Pancakes, eggs, hash browns, toast, omelets, and more. Order at register then find your table. Food arrived fast. Outstanding breakfast.
author: Gregory B.

description: Food is yummy/good. Ate here two days in a row. First day we had the Sugarmama French toast w eggs and bacon, it was delicious; also the Hombre (Chorizo Pork) Benedict (very seasoned if ur into that) and it was ok.  Second day, we had the Classic Benedict which was what I would expect and the "Nutella Stuffed Hotcakes" (which is my reason for writing in this review in the first place). This is NOT a Nutella Stuffed Hotcakes as the name implies. You are basically paying an extra $2+ for a drizzle of Nutella on top of ur pancakes. I didn't even have enough Nutella for half of the pancakes. I'll admit. I'm a Nutella fan and maybe this is why I was sooooo disappointed. Pancakes still tasted good but it's not as advertised. Again, food is good. I'd go back. I just hate ordering something and getting something else. Hope this helps!
author: Rebeca N.

description:
I ordered the bacon, egg, and cheese sandwich with cheddar on sourdough. It was somewhat lackluster. 

The egg didn't have any seasoning and the sandwich was slightly bland. The bread was thicker than I expected, but didn't really have the crunch or flavor I expected. 

Overall, it was okay, but at $7.07 after tax felt a little overpriced. I won't be returning though as after finishing my food, I got a headache from the greasy aftertaste left in my mouth and stomach.
author: Ashley M.

description: Located in the hustle and bustle of Market in SF, this place definitely had so much potential. First of all, on a busy weekend when you have a party of 3 or more, you got to be on the lookout for a table to seat your entire squad. Upon entering there was an odd smell like old dish rags, but we were so hungry we managed to look past that. I went for their chorizo scramble and it wasn't the worst breakfast I've ever had, but it sure wasn't the best either. I can definitely say that this place is as mediocre as they come with expensive prices. Overall, if you're in the area and desperate for some meh food then this will be your spot.
author: Cristal C.

description:
By 12ish everything sold out... The hash browns, the hollandaise sauce for the various eggs Benedict. This meant I ended up with the boring original breakfast: 2 eggs over easy,  Canadian bacon and fries and what toast. Really crap meal vs. Shroom Benedict with hash browns which is what I wanted.

The breakfast was OK. It needed something saucy. Salsa, beans... Something. I added hot sauce and dipped the fries in ketchup. My appetite still didn't get too excited. The chorizo scramble looked more promising. The berry pancake could've done with more berries.

This place is popular with the local lunch crowd. So how does it run out of cornerstone menu items at 12pm? Beats me! This meal should've been a lot better. The vibe is a relaxed but slight hectic communal dining experience where you order at the counter and sit down. Might try again earlier in the day...
author: Stephen P.

description: I found this place by mistake about a year and a half ago. I was going to wait in line at the place on the same block down the street that was "legendary". Kept walking to the corner and decided to try this place. Went about 10:09am and witnessed some amazing sites working the block while I ate the most amazing scrambled eggs that I'd ever eaten in my life. They should make you order and pay for your meal and buss your sh$'. What's their hours tomorrow? I wrote this review because I can still remember that breakfast today and I enjoy cooking.
author: D S.

description:
A solid option for breakfast/comfort foods on Market St. They do a good job of keeping the inside clean and pleasant despite being in a not-great neighborhood. Staff is always nice. Counter service with the food brought to your table.

Unlimited free self-service water.
author: J.P. M.

description: I was in line to find out what the hype was about Dottie's and my boyfriend and I realized that we were too hungry to wait around the corner in line next to a not so good area. We decided to keep walking and stop somewhere that looked good. About 5 min into our walk we saw Homeskillet And decided to stop, and it was an amazing decision! They have an amazing menu I didn't know what to order! I decided on the California love breakfast sandwich but they did run out of avocado (darn it) so I went ahead and ordered it anyway. It was amazing, like a grilled cheese with bacon and egg. And don't even get me started on the hash. I love hash and their hash confirmed my love for it! They have awesome employees too, but lacked elbow room, but it was totally okay when I tasted the food! Can't wait to visit again.
author: Alejandra M.

description: Was going to another place on the same block but the line was out the door. Walked into Homeskillet and got the kitchen sink scramble. Great food, not too long of a wait will come back for sure!
author: Aidan K.

description: Counter service; short line 5-10 minutes.  Plenty of open seating.  Came to table very quickly.  Both had full breakfasts (plenty of food) and (refillable) drinks for $37 with tip.  Pleasant staff.
author: Bernard C.

description: I hold this restaurant in the worst possible regard and will never return. I have no problem with the food, but the service was a complete joke and was simply unacceptable. If you dare to dine at this place for lunch, I hope your post lunch schedule is wide open. Add an extra 30 minute cushion for your food to arrive.
author: Miles S.

description: Hot cakes were very bland, syrup is really bad. Hash brown was mushy. Didn't like tipping before even ordering.
author: Anamjit S.

description:
I thought this place was alright - I went with a buddy and tried a few different items:

- Breakfast sandwich
- Ground Beef Omelet 
- Blueberry/Cream Cheese Croissant

Everything tasted fairly average.  The Ground Beef Omelet was probably my favorite item - it was a good portion of food and left one satisfied.  My least favorite thing were the hashbrowns that arrived with a couple of the dishes - really dry and flavorless.

I'd try this place again, but I'd go for lunch just to see what the offerings are like.
author: Ken G.

description: We came here because the line at Dottie's was too long. We got seated immediately. I got the hashtag and it was delicious. They have all the hot sauces you could ever want
author: Randy L.

description: Short review because not much to say other than below average, would only recommend if short on $$
author: Beau R.

description:
What makes Homeskillet especially awesome is it's location, just a few doors down from Dottie's. So, when you attempt to brunch at Dottie's and find out that the rumors are true -- a line out the door at 7am, a 90 minute wait -- you can happily skip on over to Homeskillet for some similarly hearty egg & carb therapy. 

It goes like this: you order at the counter, find a spot in the surprisingly-not-crowded dining room, with big windows facing Market & 6th (now that's some people watching!), and wait for your food. 

The brunch menu has cheeky names like "99 problems" (beef scramble), "California Love" (avocado & sausage scramble), and "Hashtag" (hasbrowns, veggies, cheese & eggs). Our egg dishes were A-OK, but the brioche French toast was vastly disappointing: not custardy at all, just egg-coated bread. There's almost nothing that disappoints me more than a dry piece of French toast! The flavor should come built-in, not from drenching it in syrup. 

Don't opt for the side salad with your eggs - it's just a pile of greens scantily topped with dressing. The homeskillet hash is worthy of the hype. 

Though brunch was just fine, the lunch menu looked a lot more promising: gourmet burgers and fancy sandos.
author: Nique F.

description:
Since the line at Dottie's was ridiculously long, we decided to find another brunch place in the area. We stumbled upon Homeskillet and were pleasantly surprised. At 10:30am on a Friday, there were about 8 people in line ahead of us. Once we ordered, the food came out within 10 minutes. Very speedy! 

I ordered the "99 Problems" which is a hodgepodge of hashbrowns, ground beef, and sour cream topped with two sunny side up eggs. Creative dish but I will probably try something else out next time. 

After you order, you get a number, you find a seat, and the waiter brings out the food to you. The business model is similar to Urth Cafe's or The Alcove's or Larchmont (all LA brunch spots). Even though all the tables were taken when we entered the restaurant, we were able to find a spot after we were done ordering our food. 

Overall, a popular brunch spot where you might have to wait a little bit to find a table.
author: Tien L.

description:
I don't envy anyone who takes on the paramount challenge of running a small business on the infamous corner of 6th and Market (photo: http://bit.ly/WpEqrs). Pearl's Deluxe Burgers tried to make a go of it for a couple of years, but I'm guessing the swarm of mouthy derelicts was at odds with paying customers who would prefer eating their burgers in peace. I know I was harassed and didn't feel a compelling reason to come back. Other operations on Sixth Street like Dottie's True Blue Cafe and Split Pea Seduction appear to be surviving, so maybe Homeskillet has a shot here since they have a similar spot a few blocks down in Little Griddle. I guess it depends how far Twitterland really goes into the mid-Market area. it still strikes me as a dicey proposition.

I had been wanting to try Homeskillet for breakfast but never could get my cajones inflated enough to get there early enough on a weekend morning. When owner John Chow decided to stay open to 9PM for dinner (quite a risk taker, isn't he?), I gave it a go on the way home. What they serve is their extensive burger selection and a carryover of their lunch menu of specialty sandwiches (photo: http://bit.ly/1kFoUgC). Having a faint recollection of the wet and sloppy burger I had at Little Griddle once, I decided to try instead the $8 Oldskool, which was a pastrami sandwich kicked up a notch by peperoncini, sauerkraut and stone ground mustard. It just got a little too rich for my taste with the sourdough toast slathered in butter and the triple layer of cheese: creamy havarti, cheddar and pepperjack (photo: http://bit.ly/1kFoWF4).

Excess is usually not a problem for me, but a nicer balance of flavors would have increased my satisfaction level, especially with passers-by on Sixth staring at me intently like I was giving away free iPhones. I have to admit what I did like a lot were the fries, which were on the shoestring side and not as oily as I was expecting. They were easy to eat by massive handfuls with little fuss. The interior is a bit perplexing as it felt like kitschy Americana after a rummage sale with tables organized in a crowded arrangement except for the ones next to the window (photo: http://bit.ly/1qnlDKw). The larger community tables appear to work for legions of lost foreign tourists searching desperately for the cable car but for solo diners like me, not so much. Given the servers were quite nice and accommodating, I'll likely come back for another late-night bite.

FOOD - 3 stars...heavy-duty sandwiches that are a bit on overkill but with fries that are right on target
AMBIANCE - 2.5 stars...a bit confusing inside coupled with the sketchy 'ambiance' outside
SERVICE - 4 stars...they keep a stiff upper lip in here given the cast of characters they must face all day long
TOTAL - 3 stars...with a little sustainable luck, Homeskillet may have a shot here
author: Ed U.

description: Solid food, friendly staff, quick service. Counter service with the option for to-go or dine-in in their small seating area. The food selection is a notch better than a generic diner, and there are a lot of breakfast options from egg sandwiches to Benedicts. We had a chorizo scramble and a porky hash, both were good but not amazing. Worthwhile if you're in the area and need something quick, but probably not worth going out of your way.
author: Katie W.

description: This place has pretty good breakfast plus good quantity. Prices are reasonable
author: Sal S.

description: Ordered two meals to go in person. 1 meal was incomplete. I've tried calling but their phone number is either disconnected or not available. My receipt number is 222452, I'd really appreciate a refund on the missing items: the over easy eggs and bacon. Lesson learned, verify your order before you leave.
author: Eddy H.

description:
Excellent breakfast, nice choices and fair prices.
Order at their counter and they deliver your food and drinks to your table. Only negative is they need more tables.
Fresh squeezed orange juice and good coffee.
Choice of deliciuos hashbrowns or salad with some of the breakfasts. Bagels are nice and lots of cream cheese ($1 extra)
I'm definetely coming back.
author: Vic M.

description: Great food, and coffee. Fast and large portions. Whenever I read the word meh in a review, it just makes me skip the review. Meh doesn't describe culinary or experience. We need more reviewers that actually review what pertains to consumers taste, and not to just criticize establishments with poor adjectives. I don't know what meh tastes like, or if I share the same taste. Food is like music. Describe what you liked.
author: Sharing E.

description:
Rating: 72/100 pts

I decided to come here for breakfast after giving up on Dottie's just around the bend, whose serpentine line was moving at a snail-like rate of 10 feet an hour.

Although it is a full service restaurant (though they do have a takeout option), you order at a register before sitting down, allowing for fairly quick customer rotation.

They have a variety of breakfast categories: eggs/toast/bacon combos, eggs benedict with hash browns/tots/greens, sandwiches, pancakes, french toasts, as well as a nice selection of drinks, and a separate menu for lunch.

After much deliberation, I decided to split the Chorizo Eggs Benedict and French Toast + Spa Service with a friend. 

The Benedict was awesome: perfect eggs (still gooey in the center), generously laden with hollandaise, all over an English muffin, pork chorizo, and mixed with bell peppers. Great quality ingredients. The hash browns were also perfectly fried, and were excellently complemented by the hollandaise that dripped over the eggs.

The French Toast was good too, though a far cry from amazing; definitely more homely than lavish. The bread was a bit thin and less substantial than one would expect given the price. ($7.50 just for the toast, an additional $4 for the fruit/pecan toppings and whipped cream.) Being a self-proclaimed French Toast expert, I'd recommend sticking to the egg dishes, or perhaps venturing into the pancake zone. As an aside, some of their plates have this San Franciscanly pretentious hole on the side. When I went, they happened to have put the whipped cream right next to the hole, so it tragically dripped out and onto the table as I ate.

The coffee is bold and highly recommended. ($3, self-service and refillable, several varieties.)

Overall, though perhaps not quite strong enough to stack up to some of the more well-known (and consequently, heavily customer-barraged) breakfast/bruncheries in town, Homeskillet has a strong case for itself as being an alternative to spending your entire morning in line.

Recommended Dish: Chorizo Eggs Benedict + Coffee
author: Derek K.

description:
Although it has a bit of a diner vibe, this is an order at the counter and then sit down place with absolutely no charm - if you know this going in and are looking for a decent breakfast, this place gets it done. 

Went on a late Wednesday morning and shared two breakfasts with my companion: the basic eggs, toast, bacon with hashbrowns and a separate order of pancakes. After ordering we sat down with juice, coffee and number and waited for the food to come out. Place was busy for a late morning but not so much - we only waited about five minutes for our order to come out. 

No issue with the food, was flavorful, cooked properly (over easy eggs came out over easy) and hot. Pancakes were thin and small (an asian style?) but good. 

What I did have was a major issue with was the cleanliness of the place. We sat next to the window, where the blinds were caked in dust - I mean absolutely filthy. Condiments on table were extremely messy from previous use (obviously no buser cleaned the table prior to our seating), food and trash on dining room floor - and the bathrooms were atrocious. 

I'm undecided as to if I'd go back. Food was OK (and while better than the average Denny's, it was nothing special), but the real issue was lack of overall cleanliness - a big turnoff.
author: Vinnie M.

description:
While it food was quite good and classic brunch fare, the second time I went here I couldn't help noticing that the cleanliness of the place leaves a lot to be desired. There are napkins/trash on the ground, especially if you're sitting by the wall. I suppose if you're doing takeout it's not a problem, but honestly it's quite unappetizing. Foodwise, I got the Haus benedict which was tasty and had a good amount of food. Before I have gotten the 99 problems which was too onion-y for my taste. 

Overall, I would not come back to this place again just because of the cleanliness factor.
author: Juliet Y.

description: The staff is grumpy, not welcoming at all. The food was average and bit on the greasy side.
author: Veronica A.

description: I always pass this place on my way to work, and I finally decided to try it for lunch. I had the button chicken sandwich on a sweet French roll and added French fries. (Sweet potato fries and side salad are also options.) Yay mushrooms! It was simple and good, and the fries were crisp. And I like filling my own water cup, get as much or little as I want. Pricing is on par with the neighborhood. I can see myself returning.
author: Glo T.

description: Really yummy breakfast! Line outside the door starts early. The place is small, but the quality of food is so good that it's worth the wait! There is lots to choose from on the menu, you'll for sure find something you love! I ordered an omelette with hash browns and it hit the spot.
author: Priscela I.

description: Quick, easy, and a killer dish. I got a salad with my omelet and both were amazing. Way cheaper than most places in sf. If your looking for a quick yummy bite this is the place to go
author: Kiera S.

description: We were trying to find a place to grab a quick breakfast and we stumbled upon this place while looking at some murals. The food was good and the service was fair. Good for the price.
author: Karen U.

description: This place was great! Originally we were in line for dotties up the street but did not want to wait the over hour wait in the hot sun with yelling hobos! Lol! So we went down to home skillet where there was no wait. I looked it up on yelp and was a little hesitant because it only had 3.5 stars but the food was great! The names of the dishes are clever hip cali names like sugar mama, California love, etc. definitely would recommend it to someone looking for an awesome breakfast without the wait! Oh and cappuccino and coffee was really good too!
author: Chelsea B.

description: We chose this place to avoid the lines at Dottie's and we are glad we did! Quick service and the food was delicious!
author: Debbie B.

description: Food was really good! Line out the door so it means it's good but it moved really slow it seems. Got the 99 problems and was very happy with it just seems a little pricey for what you get especially the coffee. I supposed it's just the area it's in for the prices. Definitely try.
author: Will S.

description:
Dottie's line was off the hook and we were hungry - not full of ambiance just a straight forward order at the counter and have a seat!

My eggs Benedict was great, I asked the eggs be poached firm , normally they overdo it and it's like hard boiled these were perfection .

We will be back fast service I was surprised when they brought the food out so quick
author: Reynaldo A.

description:
I have literally just consumed 2 pancakes the size of my head, I am currently on a massive sugar high from the jug of maple syrup I lashed on to the pancakes - that is my disclaimer of this review makes little of no sense. 

First off, beware of the Homeskillet queues - we waited for around 10 minutes to place an order and once we got to the till we were told that there wasn't enough seats for us. So we got breakfast to go. As mentioned I had 2 huge warm pancakes with grilled banana and real peanut butter spread over the top. Despite the fact we walked back to our hotel with breakfast the pancakes were still warm, soft and ready to wolf down. 

It's not very often that I don't finish a meal but I'm ashamed to admit that in this case I bottled it. I was scared I would slip in to a food coma and miss the hotel check out time. 

Anyway I was impressed with Homeskillet but not blown away - great food but I would loved to have sat in for the real diner experience. Note to self, next time I visit don't go on a Friday morning at 9am!
author: Stevie M.

description: Oh man. This placed saved our morning,  and really we owe it all to the girl in front us in line at Dottie's.  I had the Hashtag and my guest had the Gypsy Hash. We absolutely LOVED their hashbrowns and the sour dough. We both left happy and with full stomachs. So if you're sick of the line at Dottie's or just looking for a solid breakfast joint head to Homeskillet.
author: Katelyn I.

description: Fast service, I really love how you order before you sit- helps with the speed of service. Hash browns, green tortilla and French toast are fire! Can't wait to come again!
author: Chaka H.

description:
I found this place when I decided to venture out to the infamous  Dotties Cafe. Dotties had a wait and wouldn't let me order to go, plus I had a flight to catch, so I had to find an alternative. 

This place was right up the street and available.  I ordered the chorizo scramble,  which is what I was going to try at Dotties, and got my order within 5 minutes.

The service was fast, the place is cute and simple. The prices are great and the amount of food is enough for 2.
author: Melissa H.

description: We had planned to hit up another breakfast place, but the line was too long. We had originally walked by this place, and I decided to come back. Glad we did! Not a long wait, and the food was delicious. Great portion sizes and full of flavor. Would recommend!! They definitely cheese it up, which is always good! :)
author: Meagan L.

description: Food was so good! Get the California Love Sandwich! Amazing!!! Also there chicken apple sausage is perfect! Also have a variety of lattes. Me and my fiancé found this place while looking for another and we're glad we decided to go in and try it out! It's also reasonably priced too!
author: Anthony C.

description: You may have to wait in line for a spot and to order but it is worth it. Fresh ingredients and creative names and food combinations. Really nice dirty chai latte and average cappuccino. Fresh orange juice. The place is super dirty though. Avoid the restroom  if possible. Three stars because of cleanliness
author: Tiffany Z.

description:
FOOD:
I really like Homeskillet because they are never that crowded so you never have to wait for a seat and their menu has almost any brunch food. They have omelets, eggs scrambled, french toast, eggs benedict and pancakes so you can get almost anything you want. The food itself is nothing bad but also, nothing memorable. 

SERVICE:
Friendly staff

WOULD I RECOMMEND IT? If all other SF brunch spots are busy, sure I would say this is an okay brunch spot but this is not my first choice spot for brunch
author: Kelley Y.

description: This place is somewhat unassuming from the outside, but the interior feels a lot more comfortable. They have pretty extensive options in the way of burgers and sandwiches, all of which sound pretty interesting. There's not much activity in the afternoon, so the food came out pretty quickly. I enjoyed my kokomo burger--the pineapple went surprisingly well with the cheese and bacon, and the sweetness actually might have helped or else it would've been too much on the greasy side. The portion is right for the price, and I couldn't finish my fries--should've gotten the tater tots instead!
author: Tony D.

description:
This place is legit - main draw is the food, which comes in tremendous variety (pick of egg omelettes, scrambles, french toast/pancakes, and various sides) and good quality given the very reasonable price point and generous portions. While waiters will bring you your dish and clean up after you, this place isn't 100% sit down (you order first, pay, then eat) and feels even more crowded thanks to its popularity and relatively cramped seating.

Food - great assortment of options. I tried the sausage egg scramble and it was delicious; my friend got the eggs benedict and those looked very good too. Try the cinnamon brioche toast - it's extremely delicious!

Ambiance - totally average place inside; would say has a homey feel and is a bit cramped, especially if you must occupy one of the communal tables. There was a 10-15 minute wait, which is more bearable than most restaurants since you're waiting in a real line. The area is a bit sketch but it's not the worst thing in the world.

Service - sort of non-existent, but when the staff do come to you they are very friendly.

In all, I'm not sure I'd come here to impress a date, but it's a great place to chill with friends over good food.
author: Amy G.

description:
I honestly believe I could live in this place.... IT IS AMAZING!!!!!! Its everything you would want in a brunch place and more!!! 

Came in with my friend around 11:40 and there was barely a wait. You order up front and grab a number before you sit(there is plenty to choose from soooo do your research before you get here!! hahaha) I ordered the Shroom Florentine Benedict with a side of balsamic greens aka spring salad with a balsamic vinaigrette and my friend ordered a fried egg sandwich with a side of fries. I also ordered a cup of BOTTOMLESS COFFEE FOR $3 and you were allowed to take some to go!!(Equator coffee) AMAZING

Service was SOOOO quick, our food came out in less than 10 minutes and the food was beautiful. The eggs on my benedict were poached PERFECTLY and the sandwich came with a huuuugeeeee side of fries, and everything tasted so good and fresh. 

5/5 stars for this amazing place!!!! :---)
author: Megan C.

description:
This food at Homeskillet is worth the wait, which means a lot coming from someone who doesn't really like breakfast and hates waiting in lines. We were in the neighborhood on a Saturday morning and decided to treat ourselves to some breakfast. The line was only about a 20 minute wait, which is really all I can take when I'm hungry.
