The line moved pretty quickly, and the only downside was dealing with the homeless people who found it entertaining to harass those standing in line.

I went savory, my fiance went sweet. I ordered the 99 Problems and WOW was that delicious. I definitely ate the entire thing (and the portions are quite large). My fiance ordered the hotcakes with a side of bacon, and everything was really good. I liked how fluffy the pancakes were. My Vietnamese coffee late was really good too (not too sweet). Seating wasn't too hard to get, although it took some stool maneuvering at the window bar area. 

Would definitely recommend this spot if you're in the area!
author: Regina L.

description: When it's busy, the seating situation is irritating and the short manner in which the lady taking orders talks to you probably doesn't make things better. There was a nicer lady putting out the food and was willing to work with us to try and get our group seated after we were told that we shouldn't have sat down first on some empty chairs then ordered. Our food was pretty good and quite honestly the wait is way shorter than Dottie's around the corner. Parking is typical SF street parking.
author: Trang N.

description: Good but some basic mistakes makes this only three stars rather than four. I ordered the chorizo benedict, which was quite good flavor-wise. However, the English muffins were a bit soggy and one of the two poached eggs was overcooked and not runny. I do highly recommend the hash browns though! They were perfectly cooked and crispy in all the right ways.
author: Trudy L.

description: My husband and I were in San Francisco celebrating our one year anniversary as husband and wife. We wanted a good breakfast before starting our adventures in the city so we chose this place honestly since it wasn't so crowded like everywhere else. We were pleasantly surprised. The crew was all very nice. The food was nice and hot and correct to order. Our lattes even came out with latte art!!  I was very pleased they had rye bread as an option.! Love rye. Lol
author: Sarah Y.

description: Food was ok but the staff is not friendly. It's a great spot to look at all the weird ass people walking by........ One more thing, it smells like piss because of all the homeless people around there.
author: Allan F.

description:
Honestly, for the money this place is great. I sat down after putting in my order and within 5min had my food. Eggs were cooked as I asked, toast was nicely toasted as well as perfectly fluffy, and the bacon was crispy like it should be. Also, a killer iced latte to boot. Only reason I can't give it 5 stars is no Cholula hot sauce.

None the less, come here, you won't be disappointed.
author: Brian Y.

description: Came here twice already and the original hot cakes are delicious and the fancy french toast so yummy.
author: Ricky C.

description:
We wanted to go to dottie's for breakfast, but didn't want to wait 45 minutes to eat. So instead we went to home skillet. We should have waited. Home skillet was disappointing. The restaurant was dirty, many tables had not been cleaned. The floor was dirty and the kitchen area was cluttered. The serving staff looked like they had just rolled out of bed. The food was ok, but we couldn't stop thinking about how dirty everything was. We
Had pancakes and a scramble with hash browns. Do yourself a favor and wait for dotties...
author: Stewart E.

description:
Food is fine - cleverly named egg dishes, sandwiches and salads, with some great combos. Food comes out quickly and the prices are reasonable (especially for downtown).

But would a smile kill you? Counter people run the gamut of non-acknowledgement to downright rude. I guess they do enough volume so it doesn't matter...
author: Carolyn R.

description: A cool NY diner vibe. You could picture Staten Island cops eating here. Huge portions. Love the way they cook the eggs in a thin crepe-esque fashion. Also props for grilled turkey! Nice servers.  Great spot for a breakfast.
author: Andrew K.

description: For those who enjoy the shredded potatoes staple known as hashbrowns with their breakfast. Amazing food complimented by good coffee. Had the apple smoked bacon and eggs with hashbrowns and it was more than filling and quality to boot. Make sure you get the sour dough bread!
author: Taylor G.

description:
We went to Homeskillet around Brunch time, and although it was smaller than I expected, there was plenty of space for us to sit and eat. We ordered a breakfast sandwich, and the gypsy something-or-other with hot and iced coffees. The coffee was decent, and ready quickly. My husband really liked the breakfast sandwich on sourdough (really can't go wrong with anything on sourdough in San Fran). My gypsy was disappointing. It said the eggs came with hashbrowns with onions and bell peppers, but what I really got were 2 scrambled eggs on top of a pile of peppers and onions. I couldn't find any hashbrowns anywhere!

PROS
quick
average price
good sandwiches

CONS
lacking hashbrowns
small building, may not have seats at busier times
author: Nicole B.

description: Casual dining spot, good for lunch, lots of sandwich & burger options, would return if in the neighborhood.
author: Victoria Y.

description: Went to dotties and it was closed... So we found this place.  Simple menu no wait but surprisingly good food!! We both got the California sandwich mine with egg whites.  Large portion so I took it home but wasn't disappointed.   I would come here again if u was in the area as a default but nothing crazy special about the place that makes me excited since I'm visiting San Fran
author: Lynzee M.

description: AMAZING! Good is great( had the green burrito with hash browns) , portions are good and staff is quick and friendly! Line goes out the door but definitely worth the wait. I asked them if I could substitute the meat with avocado and she said yes, no extra cost!
author: Luisa R.

description:
The line at Dottie's was too long (even though it's a weekday!), so we came around the corner and tried out Homeskillet. Not only did we not have to wait in line to be seated (there was enough space for the two of us and probably 10 more people), but the food came out very quickly as well--in less than 10 minutes. The prices were reasonable, and the food pretty good.

I ordered the Hastag (shredded hashbrowns covered in cheese and topped with avocado and sour cream) with two over-hard eggs and sourdough toast. This was quite good, which was evidenced by the clean plate I left behind (minus the butter wrapper). AT got the green burrito, which I thought was good but not so super amazing. It was a big burrito, though, for what that's worth.

Definitely worth a try if you're in the area and need something quick to eat (or if the line at Dottie's frightens you like it did me). I'll be back sometime!
author: Julia N.

description:
Homeskillet is considerate for brunch.

What's the #1 quandary for brunch-eaters? "Sweet or savoury?"

I often find myself choosing between the $7 waffle and a $12 omelette, persuading someone to split both with me, or trying to scrounge something on the side like a $4 pancake or $3 side of eggs. That's why it's so refreshing to find a brunch place that understands the struggle, and offers succour.

$7.50 Brioche French toast or $6 pancakes with an optional side of hash + bacon/sausages/eggs for only $2?? Who says no to that?!


---- LUNCH ----

Valley Girl Burger: 3.5 stars
A crisped beef patty with lots of garlic and gristle, topped with mushrooms and havarti.

Burning Desire: 4.5 stars
A tasty, juicy burger overflowing with chipotle sauce, green bell peppers and grilled onions.


---- BRUNCH ----

99 Problems: 5 stars
Delicious hot mess hash of potato, ground beef and soft brown onions. Topped with a perfectly cooked sunny side up egg.

Hot Cakes: 4 stars
I ordered mine with grilled bananas

Brioche French Toast: 3.5 stars

Chicken apple sausage: 4 stars

Side of Hash: 2 stars
It was undercooked, potatoes still slimy. Which is strange because the hash in 99 Problems was delicious and crispy.

Matcha Chai Latte: 3.5 stars
Satisfying, but also tastes like it came out of a mix.


Music: One day we were there they played a lot of Britney Spears and Justin Timberlake. My partner didn't like that. But he liked the Rihanna and Ke$ha.

me: What's the difference between like, "Die Young" and "Oops I Did It Again"?
him: Party Tunes vs Annoying Tweens

The man knows what he likes...
author: Letitia L.

description:
This place is a shit show. First of all, if you have no hostess I assume it is self seating so I can sit wherever I want. I came in with a group of girls and at first there were no open tables but then a large table opened up so we grabbed it. Come to find out that apparently we are not allowed to eat inside because 4 of our 9 girls ordered to go instead of for here. So they literally refused to let us sit inside. They legitimately kicked us out. And very rudely I might add. One of the girls said that we "made her manager angry." Oh really? That's funny because your manager should be the one out here trying to resolve the issue. What kind of manager just sits in the back & lets their employees yell at customers? We asked if we can change our orders from to go to for here and they said no. No attempt at all to accommodate us in any way. And did I mention how rude all the employees were? Bunch of bitchy girls.
Secondly, the food was terrible. Everything was bland and we all ordered a variety of items off the menu. No one enjoyed their food. We ended up all getting  to go boxes, grabbed some of their silverware and left. 
I worked in a restaurant all through college so I know the business quite well and they were just completely unprofessional. I'm surprised they have 3 1/2 stars.
author: Anna A.

description:
I hate to say my experience was a disappointment, yet my experience was a disappointment. Upon my arrival in San Fran I bookmarked this place and pleaded with my friend each morning to visit. On our final day in SF, he caved in and we set out to Homeskillet in search of a big, home style American breakfast.

Reaching the doors we saw a big queue, I was half pleased as I assumed this concluded why I'd been drooling over their Yelp photos all week, but word of warning gang, Grandma was right, never assume, it make's an ass out of u and me. I don't mind waiting for food, I even think in some cases the wait can make it better, this was not one of those cases. We stood in line patiently for a good 20 minutes and upon our arrival at the front of the queue were told we couldn't eat in, despite several tables unoccupied. That said, we weren't too bothered on a dine in or take out option so we proceeded to order to go.

Now the fact that our food (a full cooked breakfast) was ready in literally 3 minutes should've been telling, nevertheless I trotted down Market Street in fine spirits eagerly anticipating the taste sensation awaiting me in my styrofoam gift box.

Whether the 90 second walk back to the hotel had any impact I don't know, but that taste sensation turned out to be dried out bacon, slightly soggy toast, and rubber-like eggs.

All-in-all, Homeskillet underperformed and under delivered.
author: Matt F.

description: Great place, clean and friendly. I ordered the chorizo Benedict.  At my table inside of 5 minutes. It was delicious!
author: Daniel F.

description:
I might give a 5 star once I try their breakfast but for now 4 stars will do.

I've had lunch with my fam and friends here a few times and it's been consistent.
Burgers are good.
Salads are delish.
Fries were great but could salt
Service were good.
The place can get packed for lunch.
A good place for good food despite of the area.
author: Learnee L.

description:
I must say, I'm not fancy on giving out 5 stars... Perfect is hard to come by but, this place has lifted my spirit. 

I have never had such a great breakfast before. Everything about it my taste receptacles signaled to me that I was tasting magnificence. 

I ordered the "99 problems." At that moment I may have had 99 problems but food wasn't one of them. 

My meal was just so amazing I'm for once stuck for words. Just go eat there. It's well worth it.
author: Danny V.

description: Ate here twice. The food is filling and tastes decent but was crazy oily. I had the California love sandwich, which is basically a big BEC with avocado. It was so oily I had to wipe my hands on a napkin whenever I put it down to avoid contaminating everything with oil. The hash browns were similarly oily. The next day I had the old fashioned breakfast. It was less oily but the hash browns remained as oily as ever. It wouldn't stop me from coming back but I'm looking for some new options today. The staff was Pleasant and there is plenty of seating and clean bathrooms.
author: Luis F.

description: My go to place for lunch, it's fast and has a wide selection.  Great assortment of brunch/breakfasts items, buggers, salads, and cold sandwiches.  Their tater tots are great!  I've ordered take out and dined in; staff are friendly and the place is accommodating.  It has a diner vibe, and get a big lunch take out crowd.  You seat yourself and order at the register, so if you're looking for a place with some ambiance and a waitress to wait on you - you'll be highly disappointed.  However, if you want some good breakfast, quick service, or a strawberry and spinach salad...come here. =)
author: Luarnie B.

description:
Best breakfast I've had in years!!! My husband and I were just driving around and seen this place packed so we decided to stop and try it. The long was long but the service was extremely fast. He waited in line to order while I found seats. (You seat yourself) after he order our drinks were brought to us very quickly and minutes after our food was brought out!! We ordered the eggs Benedict & the old fashion with a side of hot cakes! And let me just say we cleared our plates! It was delicious

We will definitely come back!!
author: Sandrah D.

description: Overall a decent place with your typical breakfast fixings. The seating was a little crowded, but service and food were speedy! I ordered the eggs benedict (my favorite), and while the English muffin was hard to cut, it was thick and chewy! The yolks were also perfectly runny.
author: Connie X.

description:
Flew in from SoCal early this morning and we were on a quest for breakfast. Homeskillet was right on the corner and looked homey and not crowded - I'm in!

Great looking menu (funny, too) and super friendly staff. We placed our order up front for a blueberry donut, the Hashtag plus bacon, the Haus Benedict, and 2 hot teas. $30 - pretty good for all that food.

Donut came over with the tea. It was good - not dry and not too sweet. It was labeled "vegan" so I guess no eggs in it? Couldn't tell the difference.

Boyfriend had the Hashtag which was a pretty simple dish of 2 medium eggs, and their signature hash topped with cheese, sour cream, and avocado. I had the Haus Benedict which was your standard English muffin topped with poached eggs, smoked turkey, bacon, avocado, & hollandaise. Holy yum. Note about their hash - it's very heavy on the onion which I love, but if you're not an onion fan you might be put off.

As the other reviews noted, they just opened. I'm super impressed that they are running so well with less than a week under their belt. Friendly, quick, and delicious. I predict a line out the door as their popularity grows. Thanks for a great start to our trip!
author: Carol Z.

description:
I'll always miss Pearl's on this corner...but I'm very happy that HomeSkillet has moved to the neighborhood.

1. Breakfast! Finally, a bagel/breakfast sandwhich/donut spot in the TL. Totally overdue and homeskillet is great for the bagels!

2. Lunch sandwhiches. The prices are up there...to where you wouldn't want to go here every day..but it's a great spot for that twice a week stop! I love the valley girl (garlic!) on sourdough

3. Nice staff, great service! :)
author: Carina M.

description:
Used to come here all the time on my way to work for their dirty chai latte and I'm happy to say that it still tastes the same :]

I've only had their breakfast here and I've enjoyed it all from their veggie omelets to their egg benedicts, and I don't like pancakes but their chocolate chip pancakes are yummy!

Never tried their pastries but I'm going to have to try their vegan donut next time.

Docked a star because their hot sauce bottles are all sticky and the prices here are a bit steep but I suppose the portion size makes up for it.
author: Jenn K.

description:
Honey and I decided to try this place after looking at the reviews on yelp.  We were staying in Union Square for a Valentine's get away.  It was a short walk on a sunny SF day.  The neighborhood has its share of interesting characters, which makes for good people watching.

Honey ordered the California Breakfast Sandwich, which comes with a salad.  He reported that it tasted great and he finished every bit.  I ordered the Sunrise Green Burrito with chorizo.  This is supposed to be an egg breakfast burrito.  It came with hash browns.  I enjoyed it, but found it light on eggs.  There was plenty of burrito if you are not a big eater.  Next time I would try one of the sammies or one of their other options.  Overall, I enjoyed the diner atmosphere and food.  We will definitely come back again, next time we are in the city.
author: Jennifer C.

description: This place is awesome for breakfast, brunch, or lunch! This place is usually crowded and seating has always been an issue, if you're by yourself, I would totally recommend take away! Super close to the Westfield mall on market st
author: Katelyn K.

description:
Visited here last time we were in the city. It's a chain but I def recommend it. I had the chorizo scramble and my bf had the 2 eggs w potatoes and bacon bfast. Great price and good quality overall and a win when you are looking for a nice filling bfast after a night out on the town :) 

Oh yah and the names of the bfast are pretty funny.
author: Michelle B.

description: Everything was absolutely delicious!! Especially the pancakes !!! We were pleasantly surprised since we had come here after the discouraging line at a nearby diner... this was exactly what I was looking for on my Christmas shopping weekend Fresh homestyle cooked meals that are cooked to perfection. Family friendly, clean and great views as it's on the corner lot.
author: Anthony B.

description: Starving after a late night. Short wait in line to order your food then they bring it to you. Chorizo hash was great and so was the coffee. Everyone in the group seemed to enjoy what they ordered for breakfast.
author: Niveet N.

description: Terrible! Hashbrowns are soggy and bacon is nothing but a slippery pile of grease. But if you're looking for a good cup of coffee and fresh OJ, this is the spot!
author: April N.

description: Went down the street to another cafe, line was around the corner.  We really just wanted quick good food.  This place was fast! All the food was hot and well prepared.  Staff was friendly and efficient.  Would come again when in town.
author: Sylvia V.

description: Talk about an extremely SOLID spot on the corner!! Homeskillet has a very diner like feel to it, with very good plates made to order. From pastries and coffee to actual breakfast meals, everything is made FRESH and you can taste it. We had "The Original," along with a side of original hot cakes (2 big cakes) and banana chocolate chip French toasts (3 well portioned slices with griddled banana). All VERY good and satisfying, left us leaving happy and full. Only downside (if any) would be the self-serve aspect. Not that it's that big a deal, but it kind of reminded me of home. Lol Still, staff was very friendly and the food was delicious. If you're on market street in San Fran, give this place a try.
author: Alex C.

description:
Very good food!  The set up is strange.  You have to wait to be seated then you walk up to the cashier table to order your food.
We enjoyed the "Classic Breakfast" and the "Eggs Benedict" .  The smoked beacon was flavorful and crisp.  The Canadian beacon was very tasty unlike most that taste bland and like rubber.
Best breakfast in Alameda!
author: A A.

description: Ummm...I think I just finished eating the best chocolate croissant ever. Holy mouth orgasm! I love this place, if you're in the area it's a must for breakfast / brunch. I work across the street and frequent often. My taste buds always thank me, waistline, not so much :)
author: Gladys R.

description: Came here as a second choice, Dotties had a line that wrapped around the building , so decide to give this one a try. It was good and super fast!!!! Head to the counter and order and they bring you your food!! Pancakes were delicious and cinnamony... The hashtag breakfast was fabulous!!
author: Carolynne A.

description: OK I am really shocked on how much I liked this place. When I first saw it, I was kinda like...eh....it didn't look super clean and fun. It looked like a divey spot to eat to be honest. They had an interesting menu with not your usual breakfast items. I went there around 12ish so they were sold out on the eggs benedict and the special croissant french toast so that was a huge bummer. My gf and I split the banana and chocolate french toast and it was beyond delicious!! I'm not even a big french toast fan. No need for syrup, it was delicious with out it. My gf had the hashtag and she really liked it and I had the california lovin sandwich with tots.....Mmmmm tots. Tots are the best things invented. I would definitely come here again...except there was weird stuff floating in my water. But it was yummy!!!
author: Heather S.

description: Just like another person said, when you don't feel like waiting in line for Dottie's, this place definitely fills in. Great food and nice employee's.
author: Justin T.

description: Customer service when ordering was good. However, the food was not. I ordered eggs over hard (*very hard*), crispy hash browns, avocado and a side of onions & peppers. The yolks were still soft, potatoes under done and onion/pepper side was soggy. And it cost about $12, which means it should've been outstanding. If you can't make a basic breakfast, what can you do?
author: Kreutz G.

description: I liked this place. We walked around and surprisingly there wasn't a line crazy out the door so we looked at the menu and ordered. We got the California Love, Suga Mama (French Toast) and the original Benedict... I don't know if it was just our food or if we were too hungry but it tasted amazing. We got vanilla lattes and they brought them right to our table and the service was so fast. The place is kinda small so I felt really squished but that's almost any place in SF. I'd definitely come back
author: Yanna V.

description:
Good size portions and reasonable prices. Hot cakes were plate sized and highly rated by an 8-year old expert. Brioche French Toast had the right amount of cinnamon flavor and a good crunch. 99 problems was a very flavorful egg dish with hash browns and ground beef.
Right mix of self-serve and service. Staff was all friendly.
author: Brian O.

description:
First time here and overall I really enjoyed it.  Since I don't live in Sran Fran and have never been here I stood at the entrance waiting to be seated with two employees staring at me.  After a couple minutes I asked if I was going to be seated and a third employee finally told me I need to order at the counter and then they would bring out my food.  I will cut them some slack since the first two guys were new and being trained but they really do need a sign that says "Please take a menu and order at the counter when you're ready."

The food was fresh and very tasty.  Unfortunately, they don't have their pancakes a la carte so I basically had to get two entrees to try their chocolate chip pancakes.  They were delicious but get cold quick so make sure you eat them first.  Overall, very much worth the extra entree price.  The bacon and eggs were also very good.

I know it's basically a self serve restaurant but it would be nice if they checked on you and how your meal was and/or offered you more of your beverage without having to go to the front counter and ask for it.

Definitely tasty breakfast and I would recommend it to locals or visitors.
author: Cheryl C.

description:
I come here almost ever weekend as I live in the neighborhood. Really nice staff, good food and it's cheap. I kinda wish they had mimosas but they do serve equator coffee which is bomb diggity! 

They keep the portions large and have a lot of good vegetarian options. Haven't come here for lunch yet, but the menu looks good. 

The line is nothing like Dotties, it moves fast and the food is as good if not better on my opinion. They stick to the classics and do it well. 

Definitely a favorite since I moved to the city!
author: Lief B.

description: This was the best breakfast I've EVER eaten. The potatoes are by far the most amazing breakfast potatoes. The bacon, cheesy potatoes aka pioneer breakfast ha had 2 eggs on top. Avocado slices... Super delicious. Also chorizo scrambler was superb. Even the wheat toast was great! Worth the visit!!!
author: Martha S.

description: We too did not want to spend an hour in Dottie's line. We had a party of 6 and this small spot was accommodating. Our food came out incredibly fast, and the server let our late 6th group member cut in line when she arrived.  Her food came out quickly too. We all enjoyed our food. My coffee was extra yummy.
author: Christina R.

description: The egg benedict here is delicious. They don't decorate the foods so I have to do it myself. Lol
author: Master R.

description: Just your average overpriced brunch in the City. Ordered Chocolate Chip Hotcakes (pancakes) for $8 and a granola yogurt for $6.50. Not particularly delicious, but not horrible either.
author: Alvin C.

description: So glad we found this place on a Saturday morning, we were looking for a sit down breakfast before we checked out of our hotel so time was somewhat short. We tried to go to about 4 different places which all had 10+people in line and finally found this place. This place is great for the city. Customers order their meals at the front, sit down and food is usually ready in 10 or less. Food was great, couldn't ask for anything better.
author: Lindsay M.

description: Good food & fast service. Interesting seating situation. You cannot grab a table until you have ordered and paid for your food. Also, don't plan on having someone at your table who isn't eating/purchasing, as they will ask that person to leave.
author: Michelle U.

description:
I never write reviews - but this visit warrants one.

In town with family - looking for a good place for brunch - and since the line around Dottie's wrapped around the building - (a two hour wait + impatient old Filipinos = a recipe for disaster) - we walked up and waited 20 minutes.

I ordered the Lalalalalala sandwich with hash browns & an iced Americano. We noticed many people around us were leaving - barely leaving a dent in their $15 dollar breakfast. RED FLAG #1.

My Americano comes - with a steaming cup of drip coffee and a cup of ice. RED FLAG #2.

Our food comes - very anticlimactic - but I was starving and ate the greasy plate. The bread is dry, the spinach dripping in grease - hashbrowns tasting like frozen ones from the grocery store. RED FLAG #3.

An hour later (TMI) - I'm on the toilet with the worst stomach upset I've had since I was in college. My flight back home to Seattle was less than smooth. Literally.
author: Phillip B.

description: We are out-of-towners and we almost missed this unassuming gem just a few doors down from the popular Dottie's (don't waste your time waiting in their obscene line).  At home skillet, you're greeted warmly by the husband and wife that own this family run diner where you order at the counter and then find a seat among the communal tables...get cozy and make friends!  The portions at breakfast are large, fresh and flavorful, perfectly executed, and come out of the kitchen quickly.  Thick cut multigrain toast, perfectly poached eggs, crispy and tender homefries, and fresh vegetables and fruit.  We will definitely be back the next time we visit.
author: Aimee B.

description:
My boyfriend and I actually ended up coming here because the breakfast place down the block had a disrespectfully long line outside. However, we were very happy that we came here instead. I'm not very familiar with San Francisco, but I don't think it's in a great area, as there were a large amount of homeless folks outside and around the area. 

This is the kind of place where you order at a counter, get a number, and then a waiter/host brings the food out to your table. I didn't thoroughly analyze the menu, but it definitely seemed like they had a wide selection of items, but most importantly, they had all of the traditional breakfast items (which is definitely up my boyfriend's alley). 

Although it took us a while (maybe 15-20 min) to get through the line to order, our food came out to us within five minutes or so. Also, all the condiments you could ever want in life are already on the table (yes y'all, that includes sriracha), so you don't really have to flag anyone down.

I had the #hashtag, which was a sort of hash brown scramble (hash browns, cheese, eggs, onions, avocado, sour cream) with your choice of a bagel (various options) or toast on the side. Not only was the portion big enough for me to save half for later, it was only $9! It was also just very good in general. I also had an iced chai latte ($3.50), which was great and tasted like it was made from real ingredients, rather than some sugary mix from a carton.

My boyfriend got the french toast with bacon and eggs (total of $10 I believe). He absolutely LOVED it. And let me be the first to say, I have taken this man on a tastebud magic carpet ride throughout the East Bay and I usually get a "this is pretty good" or "it's cool" out of him. But he loved it so much, even pulled the waiter aside to tell him how good the french toast was. 

They also had brunch-like items on the menu, and if I ever come back (which I plan to), I would definitely experiment with the grilled cheese options they have. Honestly, I was tempted to give them 4 stars just because the place is a little small and the homeless issue, but both things are out of their control. It just comes with being in San Francisco. Overall, definitely recommend this place.
author: Bryanna D.

description: Not the typical restaurant. You grab a menu, order at the counter and then find a seat yourself among the crowd. The restaurant is pretty small so it's best if you come with a small group. Also the tables are pretty small fitting only a couple plates each so don't go ordering the whole menu. The restaurant has a eat and leave kind of ambiance as the restaurant seems get get very busy and people are hunting down tables after ordering their food.  The food is very good. I got orange juice and the original benedict which came with hash browns. The Orange juice was so fresh as if ripe oranges were being squeezed straight into the cup, pulp and all. The egg benedict ran golden eggy yolk all over the muffin.  I love crispy hash browns and that's what I got, crispy brown potatos. If you can't get into dotties, this restaurant is a good substitute.
author: Karyn G.

description:
The food was very good!! 
The only reason why I'm shorting a star is the seating  arrangements at the place.
You have to seat yourself and the place is tiny..
It's Frisco, everything's busy! So for a small place to not have many seats & SELF seating is hectic. We lucked out, as we finished ordering 2 window seats opened up. I had the kitchen sink skillet and it was delicious and they are very generous in their portions.. The coffee was okay, I had a white Mocha, probably would've been better off with a regular coffee. So other than the seating situation and location (tenderloin-ish) it was an overall good experience
author: Jasmin M.

description: Good food, reasonable prices, good service, and no wait for two people walking in late morning on a Sunday.
author: Angela C.

description: Ran across this place for breakfast. Great food- very substantial helpings.  It was extremely quick as well.  We ended up eating there two mornings in a row.
author: Matthew R.

description: Portion sizes could've been larger. The french toast could've had more eggs. Decent fare.
author: Ganesh K.

description:
I was very surprised by Homeskillet. For what appears, on the surface, to be an age-worn diner is in fact a very tasty breakfast/brunch spot. The line wasn't too long yesterday (Saturday) morning around 10:30 and moved fast. Their menu had plenty of delicious options from scrambles and french toasts to a variety of other breakfast dishes (although no omelets). Not too big to be overwhelming, nor too small to be restrictive. 

I went with the chicken apple sausage scramble, and chose the balsamic greens as a low-carb side instead of the hash browns. When I told her I didn't want any bagel or toast, she didn't charge me the extra $1.50 for the avocado I added to my meal. 

I was most impressed by how delicious everything was - the sausage, the peppers, the onions, yum! What a great scramble. And with three cage-free eggs, and a healthy portion of salad, this was a very filling meal and a great deal too! 

I would happily return here again and have more of their great food!
author: David B.

description: Tried to order something for pickup. Was hung up on twice. 1st was a pickup/hangup. Second she took my order, told me the menu online was wrong, and hung up on me. I guess I won't be checking if my order was taken... or going in there. Ever.
author: John A.

description: After waiting 10 to order a juice and a croissant to go which they told me to do, they the. told me that I  had to wait in the line to get a table, which was 30 minutes long. This place is a mess and he staff keep contradicting each other.
author: Alex T.

description:
We stopped by here because it was close to our hotel and because the name was pretty clever. 

The wait was out the door because you order first, then find a table. This place is not very group friendly. It's a pretty small space. 

The food was average. Nothing too special. I  got the basic egg, bacon, hashbrowns, and toast. They gave me the wrong kind of toast, which isn't a big deal, but it's also not that difficult to get right. The bacon, however was disappointing. It was dry and just not worth the calories. Boyfriend got the French toast which is made from brioche bread. It wasn't bad, nor was it significantly special. 

So in general, if you're looking for just something to eat, go here. If you're on vacation... I'd go somewhere else more memorable.
author: Lynn T.

description:
I decided to give this place one more try, wrong decision! !! 
I don't know if they even understand English! !!
Last 2 times I've ordered breakfast, I've told them to not burn my food and got home and was burnt.
Decided to go there this morning because I was very hungry, I told the lady at the register when ordering, I told her to (please make sure) that my food is not over cooked, I didn't even see her go back to the kitchen to let them know it's a special order, 5 minutes or less I got my breakfast, I opened it up to make sure bacon, hashbrowns, and eggs were not over cooked. It looked okay. I got home, I ordered soft scrambled eggs, they were hard and burnt, bacon was over cooked,and hashnrowns were burnt. Toast was little over cooked. 
I had specifically told lady at register that the last time they burnt my breakfast, I asked her to Please make sure that doesn't happen again,  got home, everything  burnt!!! Are these people STUPID or just don't understand English or Basically don't know how to cook.. I would give 0 stars, but you have to put at least 1 star, I would highly recommend for everyone to not go to this restaurant, if you like burnt food, that's the place to go. Again I had told them to not Burn my food and they still did!!!! 
I will never spend any money there or even walk in the door for a napkin, this the worst breakfast I've had, this was 3rd time, I wouldn't give them another try even if that was the only place to get food, I would rather starve then eat at Homeskillet on 6th & Market. 
Now stomach hurts. I hope whoever reads this will follow my recommendation.
author: Michael H.

description:
Somehow, within the three minutes between my hanging up with an order time of five minutes and my getting to the front of the queue, they managed to give away my breakfast. 

Truly magical. I guess I'll have a hot dog for breakfast.
author: Thomas J.

description: I'm not sure what's worse the food or the service. Never in my life have I been treated with such disrespect by restaurant employees and their "manager". Save yourself a ruined mood and go somewhere else. Perhaps a place that actually serves something with flavor and knows how to treat its customers.
author: Becka G.

description: The food was good! Cute and small with a good vibe. The walk there was a little sketchy. They did mess up our eggs,  but when we told them they brought us new eggs pretty quickly. We would definitely eat here again when in a hurry!
author: Andrea M.

description: I found this place on yelp while on vacation in San Francisco and I was pleasantly surprised with the quality of food. My breakfast sandwich was delicious! And the Chocolate pancakes were very good. I really loved my latte with soy milk! The place is self order, and it was easy to find a table. Planning to return soon. :)
author: Mayelyn B.

description: Homeskillet is my ideal diner - excellent service without being too involved, reasonable prices, quality food, and really bomb bottomless cups of coffee!!!!
author: Wednesday G.

description: This is a cool spot to hit right before the grape vine. It's a buffet but a good one. They really do a good job on making southern fried food and have fresh salad. I'm a sucker for places like this but also I take it personal if the food is terrible. But this place is awesome! I highly recommend that you chill and eat here if you got the time.
author: Orion P.

description:
this review was written a couple of hours after I ate there - just to let the experience sink in. wanted to be fair.

food was great. ambiance very pleasing for a brunch experience. my son and I had a wonderful time in this place and had us breakfast food. Coffee (Ecuatorian Coffee Light Roast) was nothing short of delicious and much needed after a long walk around town.

Great food. Will return.
author: Al S.

description: This morning, my boyfriend had just got into town and when he got off Bart he was hungry and I told him Homeskillet had great breakfast. So he gets there to buy us breakfast before he meets me and he was looked at and treated like a homeless person because he had a large suitcase. He told me as soon as he walked in the cashier was telling him he couldn't bring in the suitcase. Just because you decide to put a restaurant on 6th and Market doesn't mean that everyone who walks in with a suitcase is homeless and looking for a place to sit down. I frequent this restaurant all the time with my co-workers and I will never go again if this is how they treat their customers. I bet if he were a white man with a suitcase he would've been treated differently!
author: Raquel T.

description:
Two words: tater tots.

I like this place. Everything about it is very consistent from the ordering experience and food quality, to the polite and utilitarian style service. 

This is an order at the counter, they bring it to your table kind of place. Breakfast and lunch items are served and they make good espresso based drinks. 

You're not going to get anything gourmet here, but it's good, quick enough, and inexpensive. Plus they have tater tots.
author: Mallie M.

description: There was a wait but it was worth it! It was definitely worth your buck. They gave big portion sizes & it was delish! Downside, there's not a lot of sitting area.
author: Angelica G.

description: Small but seated by waiters so you don't have to hustle for seating. Coffee and French toast were good. Fast service but no interaction with waiters.
author: Blanca R.

description: Expect to wait in line for 10-15 minutes, luckily they have menus posted on the windows for you to ponder yourself. My bf and I split the #hastag skillet and added an order of the chicken apple sausage. All I can say is YUM! What a perfect breakfast for the price
author: Mariah R.

description:
Good food at good prices.

I had breakfast here on Wednesday of this week. I live close to Homeskillet, but walked past it several times. On weekend there are lines out the door, but it was a strong recommendation from an acquaintance that finally drew me in.

I had the strawberry granola pancakes and they are excellent. Note that the granola isn't crunchy - more soft, so expect a soft granola experience. I also had two eggs and some chicken apple sausage and this was some of the best non pork sausage I've had.

Note that you pay (and tip) before you eat and there isn't much seating space (hence the line out the door each weekend) but an overall good experience if you're looking for a quick breakfast on a week day and not have to wait in an enormous line.
author: Robin P.

description: Eh, the food is ok but the register employees are rude.  I'll save my money and not help them pay these snotty broads thx.
author: Mara D.

description:
I've been here twice - after attempts to eat at Dotties left me wondering trying to find a place to eat that wouldn't take 2 hours to get food at. I'm glad I found it!

The ordering process is super easy and straight forward - they also have an espresso machine and can make actual coffee drinks vs just offering drip. The food arrives promptly and is delicious. Ask for your hash browns extra crispy!!
author: Lynne D.

description:
We actually were trying to go to Dottie's around the corner, but the line was really long and the couple in front of us told us they had been there for 15 minutes without moving, and the guy said, somewhat passive aggressively to his gf, that Homeskillet was really decent and you didn't have to wait. 

We headed there, and as promised, there was no wait. It's a small place, but it wasn't very crowded. Decor is on the charming side, tables are mostly for 2 people, but there is a larger family-style table. You order in front and then sit down, lots of things looked good on the menu. Between the two of us we got a haus benedict, a blueberry vegan donut, and 99 problems. I also got a lavender soy latte. I was craving cafeteria-style tater tots so I got that as a side to the benedict. Everything was good, though I was slightly alcohol-influenced from the night before, so the food got a little heavy for me half way through. The eggs were cooked well (runny but not too runny), and the bacon and turkey on the benedict were both really good. Tater tots just as I imagined. The dishes are pretty large and the english muffins are really thick and filling. 

The blueberry donut was really soft and had good texture. The lavender latte wasn't so special - slightly cold and not super aromatic. 

We went back to check out the line at Dottie's afterwards - the couple was still in line and made some signs of despair. We may have laughed.
author: Catarina P.

description:
Good sandwiches, maybe a little bit greasy but great taste. I come here almost every morning to get my everything bagel with light cream cheese and ham (doesn't sound like much but it is bomb!). Service varies. One lady is great, smiling, and understand my order right away. On other days there is this lady who seemed bored, don't get anything I ask, don't look at me at all, and not really pleasant. 

Overall the quality of food is pretty good, not high gastronomy and does the job for a great brunch efficiently well!

Cheers,
author: Antonin M.

description:
BREAKFAST. Thick bacon which tasted good but was undercooked.  Eggs over hard were done nicely.  Bread; potatoes nothing to write home about. 

Service was crap. The cashier (young hipster white guy) served a major helping of Holier-than-thou with a side of Your-business-doesn't-matter. 

Food wasn't remarkable enough to endure the crappy attitudes of the staff. Won't be returning.
author: Stephen M.

description:
It's really not bad for burgers and sandwiches, but this street corner burger joint is the epicenter for what our hero will refer to as the "Tenderloin Fashion Show".  There's a lot of window seats right by the ordering counter from which you can observe homeless fashion and some of the oddest people that will walk by during a lunch hour.  People wearing a towel in broad daylight.  People wearing 80's band t-shirts drinking opening on the streets.  Two people riding on a single motorized wheel chair, one of which is sporting a neck brace.  This is a true story, folks.

The food itself is not bad.  All the sandwiches and burgers come with fries or homemade chips, which are both pretty decent.  The Jackson 5 burger here is pretty damn good and the sandwiches aren't shabby either.  It's priced right as well, with most meals going for under $10.

Follow these instructions to enjoy the most of your time here:
1. Order at the counter up front.
2. Sit down at the window-facing counter opposite the ordering counter.
3. Observe the Tenderloin fashion show.
4. Get your food.
5. Nomnomnom.

PROS:
- Pretty cheap for downtown.
- Entertaining people watching spot.
- Quick ordering and service.

CONS:
- It's doesn't exactly feel like a "full service" spot and is only good for a casual lunch.
- Location is slightly dodgy.
author: Albert W.

description: Amazing little diner! Great food! Fast service and table turn around time. If we ever make it back to San Fransisco I would definite go back! The pancakes are amazing!!!
author: Jamie H.

description: Strolled in because Dottie's had a super long line. The line here was sort of long too but it was just because the restaurant is small. The service was quick and efficient. We ordered pancakes, bacon, and eggs. The eggs were cooked very well but the bacon was very greasy and to me not quite cooked enough. The pancakes were great! Light but filling. Me and my boyfriend both are for around $23 so I say worth the price!
author: Cekarri N.

description: French Toast, Sausage and Coffee. The portions are big, so sharing would be appropriate. I can't wait to visit again!
author: Chris T.

description: Good clean food. Great coffee. Service staff makes a lot of noise throwing plates and silverware around. It's located in vagrant central. I close the blinds.
author: Greg G.

description: We got food poisoning from here today (this morning). We came here and are from out of town, both my husband and I got sick after eating here and felt awful the rest of the day.
author: Jackie A.

description: Great Alternative to Dottie's, when you don't want to wait in line. Quick service & Good French Toast!
author: Tara B.

description: Went here on a busy Saturday morning, had no trouble getting a table, I like the order at the counter format. The eggs benedict with the chorizo was amazing!
author: Erin C.

description:
Ugh. So good. Got a chicken avocado sandwich, would definitely recommend. 

My friend got the 99 Problems and felt it had too much onion, but was still great. 

Line wasn't long around 10am on Sunday, and it moved quickly.
author: Tom P.

description: Came for a late lunch in July 2015. Burgers were better than Super Duper but still greasy enough to give me a slight upset stomach. I eat a wide variety of burgers, including The Habit and In-N-Out, and these Homeskillet burgers weren't that great, especially given the prices. Next time I'll grab something at Westfield instead.
author: SiliconValleyShoeGirl L.

description: Dotties was too full and that might've been lucky for us.  Great breakfast food-- great coffee here!  A little pricey but I'm finding that to be the case everywhere in San Francisco.
author: Clint L.

description:
I'm glad they took over this space cuz it's homey and I enjoy seeing the different personalities of the neighborhood come together in this small space. 

Menu is similar to Little Griddle. I enjoy their espresso concoctions and just fell in love with their matcha chai latte. Check out the pastry counter, especially their vegan donuts...mmm!
author: Catalina C.

description:
A buddy brought me out for lunch last week, and on our way to Tu Lan, we noticed that Homeskillet had already opened (super fast turn-around since the spot was Pearl's Deluxe) and decided to give it a shot.

Service at the counter was super friendly and fast. The burger was really good for the price, but the lettuce and tomato on top were not great quality and detracted from my overall enjoyment. I appreciate the level of sauce, not too dry and not sloppy, and shoestring fries were unexpected, but tasty. 

For having been open less than a week, Homeskillet really has their act together. I just hope they improve the produce quality.
author: Quinn S.

description: Delicious omelettes, FAST service, coffee is excellent!! Nice little place to have breakfast.
author: Ivette C.

description:
I came here because I wanted to see what exactly replaced Pearl's. 

I'd have to say the place is not bad. Nothing to really write home about, but at least my curiosity is fed. Right when you enter, you'll see the counter from where you'll place your order. Paper copies of the menu are available before the counter as well. As soon as your order is placed, you go find a seat in the dining room. In the past few times where I've walked by this place, I'd say it was half full at most, so there's ample seating! And since it's on the corner, it's a good restaurant where you can people watch from the inside since the windows are so huge.

I ordered a Jackson 5 burger mainly because it included avocado and bacon (OK maybe the name sounded cool too), which came with a side of fries. They might as well have called it a California burger, right? Make no mistake, the burger is huge, and it can easily send you into getting uncomfortably full especially with the fries. So you'll definitely get your money's worth. 

However, the burger was OK. It wasn't as tasty as I had hoped for, and the burger fell apart very easily. I know it's a greasy burger and all, but for it to fall apart so quickly kinda dampened the experience. The fries were fine though. 

If you are curious about this place, give it a try. If you want a filling meal for a reasonable price, this place will do. Honestly, I do want to come back to try the breakfast items, so a solid 3 stars for now.
author: Loren John B.

description: The only reason we gave this place a shot was because Dotties next door was closed.  But we said "what the heck".  I ordered the Chorizo Eggs Benedict with hash browns.  First the eggs were over cooked, they were not runny as they should or else its NOT EGGS BENEDICT and one was deformed and pretty much a boiled egg.  Sucks is that they gave this order the green light to be served.  The Chorizo was bland and had NO flavor, the restaurant was "meh".
author: Jose Mario M.

description:
I love coming here for coffee, pastries or a quick sandwich.  Prices are very affordable ( Equator coffee for 2 dollars = awesome !! ) and it's a cute and quirky place if you are in a hurry, or have time to chill.

The workers here are very nice, and if it's not too busy I like to say hi and chill.
author: Anthony N.

description: When you can't get in to Dottie's because the line is around the corner, come here. Good, delicious fresh food, served quickly. Previous negative review about having to wait for table and then get on line to order doesn't happen any more.
author: David S.

description: The food was good, but my wife found hair in her food. I noticed the cooks were not wearing hats or hair nets, which explains the hair in the food. I know accidents happens, but reading through other reviews this seems like a recurring problem.
author: Mike M.

description: The line is only outside of the door because the register is at the front of the building, not because the food is so great FYI. I ordered the pecan pancakes and added bananas. Maybe the cashier was rushing or couldn't hear/understand me, but I asked if the toppings were cooked in the pancakes. She said yes. When I received my order, surprise...the pecans and bananas were on top of the pancakes. I notified the waitress, and once again I guess she was rushing or couldn't hear/understand me. She asked if I wanted them to remake them. I said yes if you're going to make it with the toppings in the pancakes, otherwise, I could just move the toppings to the side and eat the plate that was brought out. She said they could do it. She brings the next plate out and all they did was serve me PLAIN pancakes with the eggs & meat they served on the previous plate. I don't understand not mixing the toppings in the batter. I could have brought my own banana, sliced it, and sprinkled pecans on top for that lol! I could have just eaten the first plate because the pancakes lacked flavor and the rest of my meal was now cold. I ate a couple of bites, then I was over it. I left still hungry and had to go elsewhere to purchase a meal.
author: Meagan M.

description:
This place is as much of a restaurant as I s a woman!
$$ for bad service mediocre food and beggers and crack dealers on the way in and out.
2 blocks west on Market street is Sam's Cafe $$ and great food and safe decent company.
author: Andrew A.

description:
This is a great breakfast joint on what is considered a pretty crazy part of town. But don't let that dissuade you from popping over. If you're in line at Dotties, starving and regretting standing there, try this place instead. The breakfast items are an upscale, fresh, and non-processed version of Denny's. Very tasty and service is quick. The line was out the door when we arrived but the kitchen is very quick, so table turnover is quite speedy. 

I ordered the traditional bacon, eggs, hash and toast. The bacon could be a little crispier but it had excellent flavor. Eggs were cooked perfectly sunny side up. Hash could be a little crispier... Mash the hash on the griddle, cover it with a flatiron so it gets a good crisp. And the toast was good! The coffee options are great! The mocha Java is my favorite.

Overall, I give this place 5 stars because you can't beat the value for the area! We will be back!
author: Travis S.

description: The churizo scramble was fantastic. However, The hashbrowns were soggy. The service was impersonal. Minimal wait - food came out fast. Priced at a premium. Inside looks cute . No outlets? Okay , it's 2015, you have had over a decade's notice to get outlets. The toast was good. I also got the chicken sausage on the side, which was alright. Not really any healthy options that sounded appetizing. Solid 3 stars and I would come back only if there were outlets otherwise plenty other places to try in the area. Also at the rate they charge is too much for a daily breakfast spot IMO.
author: George K.

description: After the plane and train ride, before sightseeing we stopped in here to fill our belly. The portions are HUGE! The staff is friendly. Service is quick. You won't be disappointed.
author: Sarah M.

description: This place was very good for breakfast.  I didn't realize it was order at the counter, but hey its cool.  It's a tiny place, so get cozy with your neighbor as you eat their delicious eggs and the brioche toast (yum!).  They give you so much food there is plenty to share.  The fresh squeezed orange juice was top notch.  Not much to look at from the outside but don't make the mistake of not going in!
author: Bianca S.

description:
Hash it out.

Awkward moment: http://www.nytimes.com/2014/06/07/world/europe/obama-honors-moment-of-liberation-in-normandy.html?_r=0

Awesome homeskillet hash: Signature combination of potatoes, grilled onions and parsley is included with almost every dish. It's not healthy. But it's delicious.

Balanced out the lighter scrambled egg whites (extra $1.50), sweet cinnamon raisin bread and hefty granola bowl with bananas and skim milk.

Smooth Americano made from Equator beans washed it all down. 

If breakfast isn't your thing (that's weird) lunch is available too like the very satisfying homemade veggie burger. No dominate flavor like beets or beans just very good.

Worth the extra $1 to get homemade cranberry sauce to make your own creation. 

Ordering is done at the counter and then you grab one of the tables. Plenty of seats give you a never boring view of Market and 6th Street.

Prices are a little on the high side ($8 - $12 on average) but the extremely friendly staff, impressive number of homemade items and quick service earn them a fourth.
author: Jason B.

description: The food is really good! We stumbled upon this place too. The service is really quick. But it's really cramped and crowded. So if you're +2 then it'll be more difficult to find a spot. I got 99 problems and it's really good! You can sub the toast for a croissant for $1 extra!
author: Joyce H.

description: Breakfast Saturday morning was on point #unionsquare #sanfrancisco #seasonalberryhotcakes #whitechocolatemocha http://t.co/KsjTNAcgK9
author: Josiah L.

description:
Been here twice so far and lovin' it!! The turkey club and fancy french toast are both amazing. There was a hell of a line out the door both times I've been here!

They do breakfast all day on the weekends for all you breakfast lovers out there. Haven't tried their burgers yet but have heard good things. Their Equator coffee's pretty satisfying and the service is on point.

They actually forgot the bacon on my turkey club when I went but they were very apologetic and fixed it up right away when I told them.

Overall, a pretty sweet breakfast and lunch spot I look forward to visiting over and over.
author: True S.

description: Self seating, short line compared to Dottie's cafe. Breakfast was good, so was its coffee. Nothing special about it's breakfast, but would recommend coming here if you see a long line at Dottie's and need an alternative.
author: Ellen C.

description:
I am so happy this place opened so quickly in the old Pearl's spot.  My friend and I were walking by on a dreary Friday and saw lights on and people inside.  We knocked, and a nice older gentleman let us in and said it was the soft opening - meaning free lunch!  

I had the 99 problems - ground beef, onions, hashbrowns, sour cream, and cheese - and it was delicious!  My first bite of beef was perfection.  The meat was super flavorful and perfectly seasoned.  They nicely accommodated my request to add spinach to the dish.  

My friend had the bacon avocado burger, and it came on a nice, fluffy brioche bun.  All the fixin's were very fresh, and her bacon was a hearty, thick slab that stuck out of the burger.  You could tell the chips alongside had just been fried and cut from real potatoes.  This burger totally outshines the old Pearl's burger, which by the end was not so good.

I saw they're pouring Equator coffee, which is one of my favorites.  In mid-Market, there's either okay donut shop coffee or super fancy coffee (Blue Bottle or Machine).  Equator is a nice, well-balanced everyday cup of joe for the non-coffee snob, who doesn't necessarily want hit or miss donut shop coffee.  And now it's right down the street!

I can't wait to try the rest of the menu!
author: Pearl L.

description: Got a hash tag and the chorizo scramble.  Egg whites were still runny.  Hash Browns tasted like they were frozen previously.  The food felt very greasy.  I enjoyed the thick cut toast and my cappuccino was pretty good. If I ever come back here I'd give the sandwiches a shot.  They looked like they were pretty good.
author: Eric C.

description: Replaced Pearl's but has a very similar burger menu. However, I will come back to try their brunch menu. I ordered the Kokomo burger, complete with cheese, lettuce, bacon, grilled pineapple and teriyaki sauce. Also came with a choice of fries or chips. I chose fries but wasn't expecting shoestring fries. They were cooked and seasoned fine but I don't really like this style of fries. I ordered my burger mid-rare but it came out well done (lol). Overcooked burgers was the norm for Pearl's so I'm pretty disappointed by that alone. Turn your plancha down and take your burgers off a minute sooner please!! A medium burger should take 2 - 2 1/2 minutes on a 500° grill.
author: Krystina B.

description: Basic breakfast. Was a little disappointed with the lack of flavor in my chicken sausage and hash browns that came with my eggs. But the joint is cute and has a good vibe. My boyfriend liked his chai latte (I stole a sip and approved as well). Very speedy service and friendly staff. It did the job!
author: Laycee S.

description: I got "99 problems" and scooped a heaping of my friends "hashtag" - not becuase I was hungry, but for quality assurance purposes of course. And wow did Homeskillet serve up a hearty brunch for us. It was served hot, fresh, quick, and in a heaping portion. The coffee was brewed to perfection. And while I couldn't finish the dish, I still eyed other patron's dishes that looked so tasty. Don't let the location fool you - this is a solid brunch choice. And great for groups because of its long, shared table.
author: Regina D.

description: Great breakfast place with very little wait time. If you don't want to wait the long lines of Dottie's. I was able to finish my meal at Homeskillet before the line even moved at Dottie's. The breakfast menu is pretty large and there's a sweet or savory item for every type of breakfast lover. The food arrived within minutes of ordering.
author: Linda Q.

description: We wanted to go to Dotties, but the line was out the door and down the block.  This was option 2.  It was '3rd ring of hell' hot inside, but after the initial shock I got my self under control and ordered the Hashtag?   The 'order then sit' approach is genius and limits your wait assuming the line is not out of control.  (ours had a bout 5 people in front of us)  We ordered, sat and had food within 10 minutes.  My buddy had the pancakes.  The breakfast burrito looked massive but I avoided it because the guy next to me was making the "I can't believe what I just did" face after he ate half the burrito.  I'd come here if you are OK with a possibly hot, possibly crowded breakfast joint with decent food and good prices.  Good place for two people.  Anything more than that and you are rolling the dice on sitting together.
author: Jason S.

description: Delicious! Had the bacon, veggie, cheese omelet and a taste of the berry pancakes...yum!!! Fast service in a cozy spot! Loved it!
author: Mia S.

description: Was driving around and the name caught our attention. Decided to try it and was not disappointed! I order eggs Benedict and man they were amazing! Waited 8 mins in line food came out in about another 8. Very clean. People complain about the area but as long as you keep to yourself your fine! Would eat here again!!!
author: Carlos M.

description: Breakfast was pretty good, but the experience was completely marred by the unrelenting intrusion and disturbance caused by a druggie woman. She entered the establishment at least 5 times and there was little anyone could do to keep her out, so she kept harassing diners and restaurant staff alike. Poor homeskilket. They might need to hire a bouncer or security for the door.
author: Marina K.

description: Came here for lunch with my co-workers and we were lucky we didnt have to wait for a table. I ordered the piglet burger with a side of fries and it was soooo juicy, huuuge and flavorful! That's always a plus for me when it comes to burgers.
author: Nicole D.

description: I've been here a few times because it's right across the street from my work.  There aren't a lot of decent spots in the neighborhood so I was really excited for them to come in.  I first came in during their soft launch and have been back since.  I've gotten a sandwich each time and they have both been good but nothing to write home about.  I'm going to keep coming back since it's a good value.
author: Blake B.

description: Not the best a area in the city but food was pretty good. Did not want to wait in line at Dottie's. I had the fancy french toast and I finished every bite it was yummy! My daughter had pancakes and mocha which I tasted and both were really good as well. Pancakes were great even without the syrup. Other daughter had 99 Problems and it was just ok and the service was just ok hence the 3 stars. Place is small so tough to seat a large group. Prices were reasonable.
author: Three D.

description:
Not bad, tasty food. 

Line out the door by lunchtime, but I don't really understand the hype. Compared to other breakfast / lunch options in the neighborhood, the food is a step down. I think they're doing well because comfort food options are limited.
author: Chris P.

description: I'm so charmed. Come here. Great donuts and the couple next to me are enjoying some delicious looking burgers. But don't order the red velvet latte..yuck what even were they thinking?!
author: Christina H.

description:
Super fresh oj, delicious food and quick service... A little pricey but it was worth it.

Get the eggs Benedict.... Mmmmm hit the spot.
author: Robert I.

description: Cozy, you see what you get breakfast joint, with character. Small venue and lines could be somewhat long on busy weekend mornings. But I had no issues finding a table for four by the time I ordered. Food quality was great and the French toast was superb. Convenient location to Market Street makes this an excellent choice.
author: Pierre C.

description: 5 stars for quick, friendly service...but sadly that's where the 5 stars end. The French toast I ordered just looked lack luster....it wasn't pretty on any account & it was overpowered with a cinnamon flavor despite not ordering the fancy French toast with cinnamon. The poached eggs were fine but the hash was a bit sloppy & soggy...not the crispness we were anticipating. Evolution juice saved the day though!
author: Nicole E.

description: Burgers are a little too greasy, sometimes dripping in grease. Other that I always come here when I visit San Francisco. First place I go to! Tater tots are a must :D. Great customer service.
author: Alec H.

description:
I've eaten here three times now and two things remain constant. The delicious food and the contentious staff at the counter. 

Look, I know times are hard and you take the work you can get but, if you're in the service industry, you need to put on a face. A face that says you DON'T hate your life. All three times I've been here, I've been greeted by that feeling. 

The food keeps me coming back. The greeting makes me think about other possibilities before I do.
author: Robert M.

description:
Just got take out from there for the first time. Got back to work and realized they gave me the wrong burger. I ordered the Kokomo, and ended up getting a bacon cheeseburger?

I understand mistakes happen but if you're paying more than $10 for a burger, I'd expect it to be made properly.
author: James G.

description: Good food, very quick getting your food out, delicious hash - super simple breakfast food but well done.
author: Audrea Rachelle G.

description: I work nearby this place, so I eat here quit often. The food and service is great!
author: Br G.

description: This place was soooo good. I'm picky when it comes too breakfast spots but Homeskillet was well worth it. The decor is super awesome. It looks like it could be a grandma's kitchen on the farm. The food was tasty, hot and clean. Not greasy. The staff was pleasant. My dad and I sat at the long table down back near some really nice people. The food and the decor truly make this place unique. I will eat there that next time I'm in San Francisco.
author: Matt W.

description: I'm really not much of a breakfast person but we stopped by here for breakfast on our way to the airport. The food was really good and the chai latte was amazing. I'd definitely recommend this place.
author: Brandejo D.

description:
I'm glad Homeskillet is adding another breakfast and lunch spot "farther down" Market. I have stopped by for a homemade donut and Equator coffee multiple times and was able to eat lunch there today. I had the smoked turkey/cranberry sandwich on sourdough with fries and was impressed. 

The sandwich itself was a good size but not sloppy and enormous, the bread was crisp but not fully toasted, and the ingredients were great. The turkey was actually smoked, the veggies tasted fresh, and the cranberry sauce was spot-on with real cranberries in it, not that jelly from a jar. The fries were very good, crispy, hot, and very lightly salted. The only knock on the food is that the sandwich could have used a little more meat so that the cranberry wasn't quite as overpowering. 

The location is tough right now but the staff did a great job with the paying customers and the area is getting cleaner by the month. I really hope the best for Homeskillet and that they add to the Mid-market regrowth.
author: Justin B.

description: Possibly the best benedict I've ever had although I'm not sure what I ate was necessarily a "benedict." I had the Haus Benedict (avocado, turkey, bacon, poached egg, and hollandaise over a sourdough English muffin). It also came with a side of freshly fried tater tots. I'm pretty sure the tots made the meal for me because they were damn tasty. The benedict itself was good and one should be more than enough to fill you up! I'd recommend sharing it with someone else for sure. It's $13 but truly enough to feed two. The hollandaise was actually what made me feel like it wasn't a complete benedict. It was more like a delicious cheese sauce. I also got the Matcha Chai Latte with soy. Sadly, I tasted no matcha and do suspect that they forgot and made me a regular chai. Tasty nonetheless.
author: Maggi K.

description: The pancakes and coffee were really good ! But on Sunday's they have a crazy wait which is not worth the effort :( but overall a great breakfast place !
author: Priyanka P.

description: After waiting in the cold to get into Dotties down the street, my family and I decided to head to Homeskillet because we were so hungry. The employees at Homeskillet were extremely efficient and accommodating. Also, the menu had a wide range of breakfast foods to choose from. My french toast was delicious and we got all of our food very fast. Overall, a very good and hassle-free experience.
author: Katera N.

description: Ordered the ordinary breakfast, got an ordinary breakfast. The breakfast sausages - I found - were unusually lower in saltiness. Heaping amounts of hash made up for the seemingly saltless sausages.
author: Barnabas F.

description: Took the family here for breakfast. Let me just say it was mediocre at best and cost me $55 for a small amount offood. To top it off, they forgot our side of bacon (along with other patrons sides) and when we asked for it the older lady rolled her eyes and basically threw it at us.  There are better places in the city to have breakfast, skip this place.
author: Jeff R.

description: We ordered the hangover burger and kokomo burger. They were both really well made and came with a large amount of fries! The only downside was that the patty was a little dry/overcooked/bland but other than that, the meal was pretty good.
author: Lisa H.

description: Sub par food at decent prices. Unfortunately nothing fabulous to write about and the servers give a bit of attitude and certainly don't smile. I guess if you have time you can wait for Dotties down the street.
author: Simon J.

description: I splurged and got the Holy Moly. Very disappointing. Didn't finish. Won't return.
author: Jon S.

description: Great food in a cool location. The neighborhood leaves something to be desired, but the restaurant itself is cool in a very diner-y kind of way. The food was great as well (I had a scramble).
author: Zach H.

description: Juices are refreshing and the Eggs Benedict are superb! Dining area is small so getting a table can take a little while, but worth the wait.
author: David L.

description: Homeskillet serves a delicious chicken sandwich! The grilled chicken is moist and served on a soft fluffy bun with havarti cheese. Yummm. You have the option to choose between fries and chips, all for under $11. They have a large selection between sandwiches and burgers, and offer breakfast in the afternoon. With ample seating, simply order first at the counter, and grab a table with your number!
author: Stephanie W.

description: Very cute place conveniently located on Market St. The food was a bit overpriced for what it was. We ordered a burrito and a skillet. Both were decent but wouldn't order them again. The coffee was a little watery. Good for an easy and quick brunch but I don't know if I would stop by again.
author: Tash M.

description: girl taking the orders was rude and not the brightest. Food was ok but the 2 stars have to be from the funky smell that luckily was toward the end of my meal. It smelled like public bathroom. I think it was whatever they wiped down the table near us with. Gross.
author: Christina L.

description: The line is much shorter than Dottie's. We waited for about 20-30 mins on a Saturday around 11:00 am which isn't that bad. I had the original eggs Benedict and my husband had an omelet and they were both good. The best part was the coffee and the blueberry cheese croissant we split  - so delicious! Not up there with the best brunch I've ever had so I couldn't give it 5 stars.
author: Jessica S.

description: The breakfast menu is pointless. You can make a scramble twice as good in 5 minutes at home. And you won't have to wait in line!!! Moreover, you'll find the service here is so poor, it'll put a bad enough taste in your mouth that you'll lose your appetite for just about anything.
author: Ingmar C.

description: Good location, tasty food, great service.  A bit expensive for what you get but I guess that's what you should expect in SF.
author: Ben J.

description: The portion size is huge. Hardly a wait once food was ordered. Good price for what you get.
author: Ty H.

description:
The food here was pretty mixed. 

The croissant french toast here was incredibly good and included fresh berries, whipped cream, pecans and maple syrup. The texture of the croissant was delicious and the toppings made the whole thing very yummy! One of the better french toasts I've had in the city. 

I also had a scrambler here that wasn't nearly as good. It had a hearty amount of sausage and veggies, but the whole dish was too wet and sort of soggy. I got a side salad as well but this had way too much dressing to the point I had to take some off with a napkin. 

Service was fine, but they were not able to serve any Benedict dishes as they were out of some ingredient (didn't specify which...).
author: Kate M.

description: Food was served fast but took them a LOONG TIIIME to serve my hot chocolate. As I am writing this, I am done with my breakfast and the drink isn't served yet. Service is really awful and the food is just as bad. Stay away from this place! If we weren't in a hurry and hungry, we could have gone somewhere better!
author: Ferlinda U.

description: This was by far the rudest customer service I have ever experienced in my life.  The server was downright nasty.  She wouldn't bus our table with the food leftover from the previous diners, so we had to pick up the previous diner's trash and wipe down the table ourselves.  We had to ask 3 times for my child's orange juice and they made us show our receipt to prove that we had paid for it.  We had to ask 4 times and 3 different people to get the final 2 place settings for our group.  They told us to take forks out of a bin on a shelf next to the kitchen.  The food was ok but the service was so awful that we would never return or recommend to anyone.
author: Kay S.

description:
We originally went to the area to eat at Dottie's True Blue Cafe, but due to a long line we chose to eat at Homeskillet and we were very impressed with the atmosphere and quality of the food!  We came back the next day as well!

Pro:
-The French toast and the hot cakes were amazing!
-The orange juice was fresh.
-The atmosphere was great!  It looked like a place you would see in the movies.
-Window seating for an interesting view of the San Franciscan natives.

Cons:
-For the price it would have been great for a meat to be included (bacon or sausage).
author: Tim W.

description: Went here for lunch before show at the Orpheum. Right near our parking and in the right direction toward theatre, so thought we'd try it. Food was fresh and delicious and prices were great, especially for SF! Bathrooms and restaurant were clean. Small, cute place. Will definitely go there again when heading to Golden Gate Theatre or Orpheum. Right by the Warfield also.
author: M M.

description: Randomly popped in for breakfast since nearby Dottie's was closed and was not let down! The #hashtag is really good for vegetarians. Really filling and not too bad price wise. Friendly staff.
author: Niraj P.

description: It's something quick to eat before classes start. My friend and I go here to eat breakfast or even lunch. The food can be a bit greasy but it's a quick and simple way to eat our comfort foods when we're on the go.
author: Christopher H.

description: Not a bad place to get a coffee or a sandwich.  I had lunch here (Reuben, with great kraut), but the breakfast looks pretty good.  The best part of the experience was definitely the price.  Plus all their lunch sandwiches come with fries.  Can't complain about the service one bit and the place was very clean.  I would definitely go back if it was a little bit more conveniently located.
author: Samuel B.

description: It's a cozy little restaurant for breakfast. We ordered the "99 problems" and the "original eggs Benedict with tatter tots". Both were flavorful and fresh. The tots were nice and crispy on the outside and soft in the center. The English muffin for the eggs Benedict was a bit thick. We had the Arnold Palmer and freshly squeezed orange juice. The drinks were delicious!!
author: Jenn R.

description: MY FAVORITE BRUNCH PLACE IN ALL OF SF! It is a hidden gem. I am obsessed with the Haus benedict- it has avocado, turkey, and bacon- a combo I haven't seen anywhere else!
author: Stephanie S.

description: Got the 99 problems and it was so-so. Was a very heavy breakfast. Customer service could be better. & For such a hip & trendy kind of place, I was disappointed.
author: Alyssa P.

description: I love a breakfast joint that offers salad instead of hash browns and homeskillet delivers. Great eggs, great coffee, fun community seating. Tasty!
author: Heidi B.

description: We have been to this place for breakfast every time we have been in town! The thing that really has me coming back is they have tater tots for breakfast and they are AMAZING. Sometimes there is a bit of a wait but it is totally worth it. Good food, friendly counter service, and a cozy space.
author: Stephanie W.
