description: Simple breakfast- eggs and sausage sourdough.. Super fast service but they forgot my tator tots ;( also charged me for refillable coffee without asking if I wanted it.  Last time they asked... Also the pancakes are really big... I just want one but they only come in two.. Next time hopefully.. Otherwise standard good eats..
author: Margo R.

description: Sunday morning at 9:45 we came here and the wait was no more then 10 mins. My wife got the #hashtag and I got a stack of pancakes. The food was really good. Service was quick and it was real close to the mall at union square. We will definitely eat here again!
author: David F.

description: We came in because where we wanted to go was packed. This place is delicious and a good little ambiance.
author: Kyle G.

description: Worst service EVER!  Completely disrespected my my wife and I yelling at me in front of the whole restaurant. Told me I couldn't get a table while my wife waited to order, said there was a party of 11 that was going to be scattered throughout the restaurant. No reserved tables, yet quick to tell me I can't sit down. Don't support this restaurant.  Plenty of other options around SF that are away from the tenderloin and have respectful service.
author: Ryan M.

description: I was really looking forward to eggs Benedict. I had seen a couple of other people already seated that had it and it looked delicious! Unfortunately by the time we ordered, the hollandaise sauce was gone. I had to make a last minute choice and was too impressed. Not much different than any other diner. I will say that the people watching is prime if you sit at the counter by the window!
author: Angela J.

description: I went here for breakfast and got the French Toast. It was okay, I asked for hot syrup and they told me they didn't have any...I hate putting cold syrup on food. Coffee was decent, not strong. My wife with me got the pancakes and said they were great but wished for hot syrup.
author: Brittani S.

description: WOW!!!! had breakfast here just now on a whim and it was worth every penny. will definitely be returning the next time i'm hungry!
author: Meys Q.

description:
I live nearby Homeskillet and I like to support the local businesses but this place is not doing it for me at all.

The service is really poor. I'm not playing the race card here but when I walk up to the counter to order, I expect to be greeted, not to be looked at and then have the white guy at the register turn around without saying a word. I can understand slow or sloppy service if they were busy but there was a very small crowd there.

Next, when I order a burger, the first question the server should have asked when they take the order is how I want it prepared. I had to tell him that since he didn't ask, I wanted it well-done. This is after I paid.

My food order was to go. I saw a sign about the bag fee charge which I was fine with since he didn't ask and he knew my order was to go I thought he just tacked it on. I was mistaken.

When the food arrived I was handed a bag with the fries in it and a greasy box which had the burger in it (not a good sign that it was greasy). I had to ask for a bag because I was not going to walk home juggling food in my neighborhood.

Now the "good part"... the actual food. I start eating the fries and I notice a mushroom had fallen on top (no big deal) but then a third way through the fries I noticed they had dropped lettuce and chunks of onions in the bag... what's with the sloppy service??? I'm not a fan of onion-flavored fries (yes, the flavor leeched out.)

Then the burger... by the amounts of mayonnaise in it, it could have been called the 25% mayo burger. It's very unappealing to scrape off the gobs of mayo from the burger. Given the way the lettuce and onion on the burger were just thrown on, I could now understand how lettuce and onion ended up in the fries. Very sloppy presentation. The burger taste itself not even at the level of mediocrity. I probably could have gotten something better from fast food.

I understand 6th/Market is not the most ideal spot but slop food and slop service are not going to cut it.
author: Alex P.

description: The food was awful and two homeless people came in and got in a physical altercation while we were eating. We did not feel safe and the restaurant did not feel clean. The staff were nice but I would never go back.
author: Hannah P.

description: I miss the customer service that Pearl's had. I like this new place's hamburgers, but their keeping me on hold for over eight minutes, and eventually just forgetting about my call was unprofessional.
author: Joseph B.

description: poor customer service. the server doesnt even smile . when she served my order as if she threw the plate on the table
author: Mar B.

description: I love/ hate you in a good way. I hate myself for the fact I will be eating there more often and I love your food. Not perfect (which I reserve five stars for exceptional service) but very good non the less.
author: Asia K.

description: First time I tried this place with a couple of friends. I think they're food lacks a little flavor. Their hash browns were probably the best thing but their omelettes  and sandwiches needs a little kick or something. I will probably go back again and try something new on the menu - I'll probably most likely be back for the donuts though...
author: Bamboo H.

description: Ended up here after disappointing news that Dottie's was closed. Food was not as good as Dottie's, but by far better than other breakfasts i have had in the area over the years whenever i had to wander around looking for breakfast because Dottie's was closed (i can never seem to remember that they are not open on tue-wed). Anyhow, breakfast was completely adequate, and i would probably not mind wandering into this place again next time Dottie's is unexpectedly not open.
author: Iliea S.

description:
I've eaten at Homeskillet twice since it opened. Both times I was pleased with the food; the taste, preparation and quality of the ingredients both times was excellent.
That said, the second time I ate there I did not get the item I ordered.
There was confusion about what dish was identified by what name and I was served a very attractive and ultimately tasty dish that was different than the item I ordered. I accepted it because by the time I was served I was nearing an appointment time preferred not to wait for a new meal. I was not unhappy with the dish I ate 
although I did ask for a refund of the difference in price ($1.50).
This was not a matter of the server bringing me someone else's order, this was a problem created by the order taker not being familiar with the menu and placing an order for the wrong item.

I'll eat at Homeskillet again and I anticipate another good meal. At the very least, I want to try the item I ordered but didn't get. I live a block away from this restaurant and welcome it to our neighborhood. I do wish it stayed open for dinner....

...and I will miss Pearl's.
author: Jay E.

description: Tables aren't really cleaned, which was a turn off from the start. The house coffee and iced lavender latte were extremely good. The food was mediocre and priced to fit on market street, but watching the line cook put the tickets on the food itself was again a turn off. Five star place to stop for coffee, but I wouldn't eat here again
author: Robin H.

description:
Boyfriend went here yesterday and had the eggs Benedict, it gave him VIOLENT food poisoning.

When I called the manager to let them know they had poisoned someone who lives in their neighborhood, he said "that sometimes happens with eggs Benedict".

Wtf?

This place won't last long if that's how they treat the locals!!
Yuck!
author: Starla S.

description: Went here after we saw the line outside of Dotties. Not the cleanest place, but the food was great! Had the Fancy French Toast & ate every last bite. I also stared at every other dish that came out because they all looked soo good.
author: Josie V.

description: Usually there is a line out the door when I want to eat here.  Try the croissant French Toast with candied pecans and fresh berries.
author: Kory-Oren E.

description: Besides the fact that they wanted to charge me $7.50 for 1 whole egg and 2 egg whites (I was told that they have to double charge me)., the woman at the front is just rude. Not a fave.
author: Lemon K.

description: Long line to wait however once you order your food then you can seat yourself.  I ordered the sausage scramble and shared it.  More than enough food to share.
author: DAWN W.

description: Cage-free eggs! It was delicious. Ordered an omelet and really loved the applewood smoked bacon. Like any good breakfast plate, you can't go wrong.
author: Hang T.

description: Very good! Generous portions, reasonable prices- seating is tight but not impossible. We originally tried to go to Dotties but their wait was way too long- and we decided this was easily the better decision. I had the Hashtag, he had French toast, and the pomegranate Lemonade was delicious!
author: Megan S.

description: I ordered the sausage scramble minus the toast because who eats toast??  The food was FANTASTIC and so was their organic free trade coffee.  The only reason I didn't give 5 stars was because the price is a tiny bit high for my taste, but it's relatively decent considering it's in SF on Market street.
author: Joe R.

description: A good alternative to Dottie's if you tried to go on Tuesday or Wednesday when they were closed.
author: Brooke C.

description: The food was very tasty- coffee hot like I like it... The only issue was the size and searing area otherwise would go back to this place for sure.
author: J T.

description: Just stumbled upon this place while looking for breakfast. The service is a little slow but it's worth the wait. We ordered the eggs Benedict (haus and regular) and it was delicious. They use sourdough muffin which is different and worked really well. Total was $30 for our meals and drinks. Will definitely be coming back!
author: Rose G.

description: Food was incredible. Had the 99 problems which was delicious. Awesome that they get eggs and beef from good sources. Would have given 5 stars if the girl at the front counter smiled once.
author: Adam N.

description: I've been to a few of the "top" burger joints in SF. Don't get me wrong they were good, but homeskillet has the best burger I've EVER had. Make sure you add bacon!!!
author: Nicholas S.

description: I had intended to do brekkie at Dottie's, but even on Saturday morning at 8 AM, the line was around the block.  Still on east coast time and quite hungry, I found Home Skillet on the same block.  What is unique about it is not so much the food, though that is fine, but the fact that you order at the counter and the food is brought out to you, ergo, you save 15-20% because no tip is required.  I had eggs Benedict, certainly not the best I have ever had, but far from the worst.  It is your basic diner with some additional regional items.  I would come here again, it is cozy and comfy and unpretentious.
author: Guy K.

description: Great food! We had some amazing potato hash, bacon and (perfect runny poached) eggs, tofu scramble, and "99 problems" Really fast and friendly service. It's worth waiting in line because tables turn over pretty fast here. Only criticism is my latte was a bit watery, but I'm from Melbourne so I have ridiculous coffee standards ;P
author: Simon W.

description: This place was conveniently located by our hotel on Market St, so we tried it. There was a line but it is not as bad during the week as it is during the weekend. We ordered a hashtag ( vegetarian) and eggs Benedict , it was odd that when we paid, it was requested we leave a tip, before even sitting or getting our food, we didn't know how the service would be so I found it weird. You have to try to get a table on your own and you also pour your own coffee( which I guess is good , because you get free refills). Once we got the food, it looked really good and tasty ( we were really hungry too) the food was good, but I ordered a vegetarian meal and found meat towards the end ( in the hash brown) I was so disgusted I just had a feeling I had eaten meat without realizing and it wiped out how good the food looked at the beginning and I started feeling sick! So be careful if you are a vegetarian, it seems like the cook everything together or they don't clean the pan/ grill in between orders
author: Andrea A.

description: Don't bother. Over priced and mediocre food at best. Good coffee though. Server was nice enough but definite stick up her ass.
author: Danya G.

description: Great breakfast. Short wait (10 minutes on a Sunday). Chorizo "Joe's Special" type skillet w/ very fresh fruit & grilled ham & cheese on whole wheat (must have been a quarter stick of butter) were delish. Plenty of food, too. Coffees were also first class. Whole bill for 2 people including tip under $30. What am I missing?
author: Gary H.

description: Went for breakfast after deciding line at Debbie's wasn't worth the wait. Had a great meal; pancakes with grilled banana, excellent combo. Good ambiance and good food!
author: Liz R.

description: This was a Great breakfast spot with a mellow vibe! In San Francisco for the Marathon.  Food was great with a pretty extensive menu, and the staff was enthusiastic, helpful, and very congenial. If I lived here, I would be there every weekend :-)
author: Elisabeth M.

description: Great food and quick service. Place is a tad small, but it works for the location. The croissant french toast is some of the best I have ever had!  The 99 problems breakfast is good and flavorful, but go with the French toast!
author: Eric W.

description: Great place for a quick, easy, reasonably priced and most importantly tasty lunch!
author: True R.

description: Like many of the reviewers, we ended up here because the line for dotties was wrapping around the building. The setup is strange; walk in, grab menu, order and go find your own seat. If you're drinking water, you need to get up and help yourself. As for the food, it was so blah that I didn't even bother taking pics. We got eggs Benedict, egg white omelette, and banana French toast. The Benedict was ok, my egg white omelette was a mess of veggies and egg whites, no amount of hot sauce could save those eggs. We never got the French toast, but instead were served what looked like bisquick pancakes w/ choc chips sprinkled on top. The place was so disappointing, we didn't even bother to ask for the French toast. I asked the server for straws, we never got those either. Tables are ridiculously small; I had to move some stuff to the window sill while we ate. We didn't finish our food, and were still hungry when we left. Next time we will go to an IHOP.
author: S. P.

description: I had the eggs Benedict florentine & the English muffins was so large & fluffy. The baked items they have look so delicious! Definitely a must try!
author: Raych J.

description: Awesome, relaxing environment and very good food. Had the rueben sandwich and it was the best I've ever had. The fries were also amazing. The owner was very friendly and the service was fast. So glad this place has opened in the area.
author: Amy B.

description: I've been here numerous times and tried a few options, deceit frittatas and breakfast items.
author: gina b.

description: this place is amazing. the ladys here are very  friendly and the food is way better than moms cooking. i have suggested thjs to friends and we come here every saturday now. just a great place with a great attitude. 5 out of 5 for making me want to stay here longer then i can. you guys are the greatest.
author: Alma P.

description: Got into work today and a co-worker wanted to order breakfast to-go...however after looking several places for their phone number, and calling their sister store Little Griddle we were unable to place an order. I realize it is a soft opening but you really should publish your phone number and menu.
author: April S.

description: About the only thing cooked right from my classic breakfast were the eggs. Hashbrowns and bacon were both burnt and really dry. They were out of hollandaise so no eggs Benedict available. Wish we had staid and waited in line at other breakfast/brunch spots.
author: Jason G.

description: the only reason people go here is that there nothing else close by. their set up is soooo wrong with only one register.if they were smart they would have table service instead. it takes forever to place your order and forever to get your food..so unless you have a lot of time on your hands i would look elsewhere. the staff is nice, but I won't be back again. If you do go and like wasting so much time i suggest the breakfast meal " 99 problems " it's the only thing this place has going for them.
author: Chris F.

description: This place is a gem and I'm glad to have found it on accident! It has a very mom and pop feel so it has a very comfortable atmosphere. The burgers taste really fresh and the fries are thin and crispy. Also, great presentation! You'd think how can you go wrong with burgers and fries but, well, you can. If you're a lemonade slushy lover like me, you MUST get one here. They do it right. I cannot stress that enough.
author: H Y.

description: I came here with one of my good friends on Valentine's Day (Galentine's Day for us, since we're both single) for brunch. It was around 10:30am and the line was already out the door! The place inside was a bit small so we had to wait about 10 minutes for a table to clear but once it did, our food came about 5 minutes later (we both ordered their veggie omelettes), and it was delicious! Definitely filled me up for nearly the rest of the day. I'll definitely be coming back.
author: Kristine R.

description: Burnt my ground beef to black charred ruin...otherwise no flavor to food.  When I asked to return the dish they said they would refund half since I had taken a few bites.  Guess if you are hungover and can't get into dotties this will do...
author: treven c.

description: Not a great experience here. My omelette was so-so at best. The fruit was soggy. We returned it and got more soggy fruit served to us. You have to pay the tip up front when you pay for your food which is a concept I've never liked.  Better off waiting in line for Dottie's down the street.
author: Stephen K.

description: A couple of girlfriends and I went to San Francisco for a weekend trip and on our way out we wanted to get some breakfast and then to go the pier before hitting the road. We looked on yelp and found a place with great reviews and a 5 star review called Dotties. As we got there, there was a forty-five minute to an hour wait. As we waited we were looking to see if there was anything else closer. As we looked we came across this place. It was at the end of the street basically next store to Dotties. We walked in and this place was pretty bust as well. We ordered our food and then found a seat and within ten minutes our food was out. It was fast and it tasted great. I ordered the eggs benedict with hash browns and a side of bacon. The eggs were cooked perfect and the hollandaise sauce was delicious. The bacon was cooked great as well, it was not to crispy and not under cooked the way I like it.
author: Nancy P.

description: As most other reviewers we went here because we couldn't get into Dottie's, big mistake. Should have realized that when we were not greeted at the register. Rudest service we have ever experienced in San Francisco, and the food was mediocre. My husband ordered the Simple Breakfast which consists of eggs, bacon and toast. The plate he was served had hash browns, bacon and toast. It was corrected. When I simply asked for a refund of the difference between what I ordered and was served I was chastised by the server for giving him "attitude" and then called "immature" when I apologized that he felt I asked with an attitude. Will never recommend this restaurant.
author: m M.

description: This place was delicious. We came and there was no line and we hardly had to wait long at all for the food. We were planning on going to Dottie's, however, we were hungry and the line was far too long. My best friend had the pancakes with a side of hash browns and eggs and I had the Fancy French toast with bacon and hash browns. I would recommend both, although the French toast was very sweet. Do not order if you are sensitive to things that are very sweet. Overall a great experience that left us both satisfied and very very full.
author: Erica M.

description: What a great find near the Tenderloin. I was on my way to SFO via bus/Powell St BART station. Loved the creative menu choices and really enjoyed my choice, 99 Problems which was potatoes grilled with beef served with 2 eggs over easy. Thought finding a seat would be a problem, but didn't have to wait a moment. People eat and move on pretty quickly.
author: Leslie H.
